content:

content.content: 八百万の神々
myriads of gods

content:
ヤオラ
〈副〉Quietly; softly; gently; slowly; deliberately

content.content: やおら身を起こした
He deliberately rose to his feet.
やおら座に就いてあたりを見まわした
He slowly took his seat, and looked around.

content:

content.content: 夜会を催す
to give an evening party―give a ball
天長節には夜会のお催しがある
A ball is given in honour of the Emperor's Birthday.
朝野の名士がその夜会に招かれる
The ?lite of society are invited to the ball.
皆夜会服を着ている
They are in evening dress.

field sports

a sporting man

He is on the stump.

a stump-orator

field-preaching
野外写生
outdoor sketching

a steeplechase

content:
やがく〔夜学〕
〈名〉Night school; evening school

content.content: 彼は昼間は労働して夜学へ通っている
He works in the daytime, and attends an evening school.
夜学で英語をやっている
He is learning English at an evening school.
学校には夜学科の設けがある
The school has an evening class―an evening session.
夜学を教えて下さいませんか
Will you teach evenings?
夜学を教えてもよろしい
I don't mind teaching evenings―I have no objection to teaching evenings.
夜学はお断りです
I object to teaching evenings.

content:
やがっこう〔夜学校〕
〈名〉A night school; an evening school

content.content: 夜学校へ通う
to attend a night school―attend an evening school

content:
やがて〔軈て〕
〈副〉
1. (=程無く)soon; presently; before long; by and by

content.content: やがて全快するでしょう
He will soon be well―It will not be long before he gets well.
やがてお供つかまつるべし
I shall follow you presently.

content: 2. (=即ち、とりも直さず)nothing but; no more than; neither more nor less than ［注意］英文にては概して構文に含蓄してこれを略す。

content.content: 彼女を見るはやがて彼女を愛することである
To see her is to love her.
君に金を上げるのはやがて放蕩を焚き付けることになる
To give you money is adding fuel to the fire.
思う事うちつけに
The speech of infancy is frank,
言う幼子の
Unvarnished, fair and free:
言葉はやがて
It is the sweet, spontaneous song
歌にぞありける
Of young humanity.

content: 3. (=殆ど)almost; nearly

content.content: 彼が家出をしてからやがて三年になる
It is nearly three years since he left home.

content:
やかましい〔喧しい〕
〈形〉
1. (=騒がしい)noisy; clamorous; boisterous

content.content: やかましいじゃないか
What are your making such a noise for?
やかましくするな
Don't make such a noise!
やかましい
Hold your tongue!―Stop your jaw!―Shut up!―Dry up!
やまかしい男だね
What a noisy fellow you are?―What a boisterous fellow you are?
君のようにやまかしくすると人が目を覚ますよ
You will disturb people's repose.
職工がやかましく増給を請求している
The operatives are clamouring for higher wages.
おやまかしう
I am sorry to have disturbed you―Excuse me for disturning you!

content: 2. (=議論や世評などのやかましい)much discussed (question); vexed (question)

content.content: 問題がだいぶやかましくなってきた
The question is being much discussed.
当時はやかましい問題だった
It was a much discussed question―a vexed question―at the time.
議会で不信任問題がだいぶやかましい
The question of non-confidence is much discussed in the house.
この問題が世間でまたやかましくなってきた
The question is again at the front.
政府の処置には世間でやかましく反対した
The public loudly protested against―cried out against―the government's measure.
やかましく攻撃する
to cry out against―raise an outcry against―a man or his injustice
君の行動は世間の攻撃の声がやかましい
The public are crying out against your conduct.
この問題について輿論がだいぶやかましかった
The public raised an outcry on the question―The question awoke a clamorous public controversy.

content: 3. (=厳しい)severe; strict; stringent; rigid; exacting

content.content: ばくちは警察でやかましい
The police are severe on gambling.
検査がやかましいからたいがいの品は通過しない
The examination is strict―so much so that most articles do not pass.
検査がやかましいから社会主義に関する出版物は出せない
The censorship is strict―so much so that socialistic publications have no chance.
やかましい先生だ
He is a strict teacher.
あの先生は文法がやかましい
He is a stickler for grammar―a precisian in grammar.
やかましい親父だ
He is an exacting father―(長官などを評して言えば)―a rigid disciplinarian
さすがのやかましい親父もあの時だけは主義を曲げたからおかしい
Rigid disciplinarian as he is, he for once departed from his principles.
親父は風儀がやかましい
He is a stickler for morality―a strait-laced man―a puritan.
先生は礼儀がやかましい
He is a stickler for punctilio.
彼はやかましい主人に仕えている
He serves a hard master.
今度の主人がやかましくてとても辛抱ができません
I can not get on with my new master.
今度の校長はやかましい(教育に対する監督が厳しい)
The new principal is a hard taskmaster.
そうやかましく言わないでも返す時は返すよ
There is no need to pressing me so hard, for I shall pay you all in good time.
あれほどやかましく言ってもまだ聴かない
All my talk has been in vain.

content: 4. (=口やかましい)fault-finding; carping; cavilling; captious; censorius; critical; hypercritical

content.content: 僕がすること為すことに彼はやかましく小言を言う
He finds fault with everything I do.
やかましく咎め立てする人だ
He will carp at faults―cavil at faults―peck at flaws―He is a captious man―a caviller―a fault-finder.
世間がやかましいからね
The world is censorius―People will talk―What will Mrs. Grundy say?
日本人はやかましくないからこんな本が通るのだ
These books pass, as Japanese readers are not critical―not hypercritical.
細君はやかましい女だ
His wife is a shrew―a termagant.

content: 5. (=気むずかしい)nice; particular; scrupulous; fastidious; hard to please

content.content: 親父は着物はかまわないが食物はやかましい
My father is careless about his dress, but particular about his food.
僕の親父は食う物はかまわないが酒がやかましい
My father does not care about his food, but he is particular about his wine―but he will have good wine.
君は着物がやかまし過ぎる
You are too particular about dress.
手段を選ぶにあまりやかましくては困る
You must not be too nice about the means―too scrupulous about the means.
手段を選ぶにやかましくては金持ちにはなれぬ
If you are scrupulous about the means, you will never get rich.
君はやかましいことばかり言う人だ
You are hard to please―too fastidious.
役人はやかましいことを言うものだ
Officials will make difficulties.
彼は交際する仲間をやかましく吟味する
He is choice of his company.
人物をやかましく吟味する必要がある
Personal character must be weighed in the nicest scale.
僕は品質をやかましく吟味する
I am nice about the quality―particular about the quality.
一生の連れ合いを選ぶのだからやかましく吟味しなけりゃならぬ
You must be most careful in choosing―You can not be too careful in choosing―a partner for life.
あれはやかましく吟味して選んだ細君だ
His wife was chosen with the utmost care.
君のことだからやかましく吟味することだろう
You must be nice in your choice particular in your choice.

やかましや〔喧し屋〕
〈名〉(小言を言う人は)a fault-finder; a caviller; a captious man:(むずかしいことを言う人は)a fastidious person:(厳しい人は)a rigid disciplinarian:(礼儀や文法の厳しい人は)a precisian:(風儀のやかましい人は)a strait-laced man:(女なら)a shrew; a termagant

〈名〉A family; a party; a set

content:
やきはらう〔焼払う〕
〈他動〉To raze (a city) to the ground; to lay (a city) in ashes; to lay (a city) even with the ground; to lay (a city) level with the dust; to lay (a city) in the dust

content.content: 降参するかさもなくば都を焼き払うぞ
Surrender, or we will raze your capital to the ground.
全市を焼き払われた
The whole city was razed to the ground―laid even the ground―laid level with the dust―laid in the dust―laid in ashes.
近頃の火事で全村焼き払われてしまいました
The late fire has made a clean sweep of the village.

やきぱん〔焼麺麭<焼パン>〕

content.content: 原板が保存してありますからいつでも焼き増しができます
The negative is preserved, so you can have more copies taken at any time.

やきもきする〔ヤキモキする〕

content.content: 君は何でヤキモキしているのだ
What are you chafing about?
彼は虐待されてヤキモキしている
He is chafing against ill-usage.
いくらヤキモキしてもなるようにしかならない
Fret and fume as you may, things will take their own course.

content:
やきもきする〔ヤキモキする〕

content:
やきもち〔焼餅〕
〈名〉Jealousy; the green-eyed monster

content.content: 焼き餅をやく
to be jealous―burn with jealousy
日本が偉くなり過ぎると列国が焼き餅をやく
The other Powers will be jealous of Japan's greatness.
彼は焼き餅がやけて堪まらないのだ
He is bursting with jealousy.
焼き餅げんかする
to quarrel out of jealousy
細君は焼き餅やきだ
His wife is a jealous woman.
目を引っ込まして焼き餅をやいている
She is consumed with jealousy.

Nearly every Japanese student plays baseball.

content:
やく〔焼く〕
〈他動〉
1. To burn

content.content: 手を焼く
to burn one's fingers
あの男の世話をして手を焼いている
I have burned my fingers in trying to help that man.
口を焼く
to burn one's mouth
家を焼く
(わざとなら)to burn a house―set fire to a house―(自分の家を火事でなら)―have one's house burnt down
彼は近頃の火事で家を焼いて今普請をしている
He had his house burnt down in the late fire, and is building himself a new one.
家を焼いてもせめて道具だけも出せばよかったに
If the house could not be saved from the flames, you might, at least, have brought away the furniture.
地震で火災を起こして市の大半を焼いた
The earthquake caused a fire, which destroyed the greater part of the city.
その火事で町をきれいに焼いてしまった
The fire made a clean sweep of the town.
この鉄器を真赤に焼いてくれ
Heat these irons red-hot for me!
炎熱焼くが如し
The sun is burning hot―The sun is broiling hot.
焼いて粉にする
to calcine―frit

content: 2. (=食物を焼く)to roast (meat); to broil (fish); to grill (chicken); to bake (bread); to toast (bread); to do (meat or fish or chicken)

content.content: 肉を焼く
to roast meat
肉は今焼いている
The meat is doing.
肉はあまり焼かないのが好い
I like meat half-done.
この肉は焼き加減が好い
The meat is done to a turn.
魚を焼く
to broil fish―do fish
この魚は焼いたのが好い
I like this fish broiled.
魚はこんがり焼いたのが好い
I like fish done up brown.
この魚は焼いて食う
We eat this fish broiled.
魚は焼くばかりにできている
The fish is ready for the fire.
鳥を焼く
to roast chicken―(直火でなら)―grill chicken
パンを焼く
(こしらえるためなら)to bake bread―(火を通すの意味なら)―toast bread
芋を焼く
to roast potatoes―bake potatoes
炭を焼く
to burn charcoal―make charcoal
瓦を焼く
to burn tiles―make tiles
煉瓦を焼く
to burn bricks―bake bricks―fire bricks―make bricks
瀬戸を焼く
to bake pottery―fire pottery―make pottery
写真を焼く
to print a photograph―print off a photograph―print out a photograph―expose a plate to the sun
写真を焼き過ぎる
to solarize a photograph

content:

6. (=灼熱法を施す)to cauterize (a wound)

to be jealous―burn with jealousy
日本が偉くなり過ぎると列国が焼き餅をやく
The other powers will be jealous of Japan's greatness.
細君がやく
His wife is jealous of him―jealous of her.
目を引っ込ましてやいている
She is consumed with jealousy.
やくな
Don't give way to jealousy!
世話を焼く
to make oneself useful―(悪い意味なら)―meddle
彼は店の世話を焼いている
He makes himself useful in the shop.
万事に世話を焼いている

He will meddle in everything―poke his nose into everything―thrust his nose into everything―have a finger in every pie―He is a meddler―a busyboy.

to give one trouble

She has caused me much trouble―led me a pretty dance.

〈名〉
1. (=官職)an office; a post

content.content: 役を勤める
to hold an office―hold a post―fill a post
彼は何役を勤めているか
What office does he hold?

He holds office of adviser.
君にこの役が勤まるか
Do you think you can fill the post?―Do you think you are fit for the post?
僕にはこの役は勤まらない
I am unfit for the post―unequal to the task.
あの人ならどんな役でも勤まる
He can fill any post―He is fit for any post―He is equal to any task.
彼らは毎日時間通りに出勤さえしていれば役が勤まるものだと思っている
They think that, if they go to the office regularly every day, their posts are well filled―their duty is done.
彼の今度の役は柄にある、柄に無い
His new office is in character―out of character.
この役は僕には重過ぎる
My office is too onerous for me.
この役はなかなか楽じゃない
The office is no sinecure.
役を退く
to retire from office―resign one's post
彼は役が上がった
He has been raised to a higher office―promoted―(免職になったの意味なら)―He has lost his place.

content: 2. (=役目)(one's) duty, office, function, part

content.content: 何の役をする
to act as―officiate as―function as―functionate as―serve as or for―do duty as or for―something
亭主役をする
to officiate as host―play the host―do the honours of the house
主婦の役をする
to officiate as hostess―play the hostess―do the honours of the table
俺が仲人の役をしよう
I will act as go-between.
君が審判官の役をしてくれ給え
You will act as umpire―be umpire―see fair play.
誰が通弁の役をするのか
Who will act as interpretor?―Who will interpret?
彼は学校で幹事の役をしている
He acts as manager―does duty as secretary―in the school.
この箱は食卓の役をする
This box will serve for―do duty for―a table.
この室が事務所の役をしている
This room serves as―does duty as―the office.
代名詞は名詞の役をする
A pronoun does duty for a noun.
重い役をする
to play an important part―play a weighty part
今の戦争では飛行機は重い役だ
In modern warfare, the aeroplane plays an important part.
教師は教える役
It is the duty of the teacher to teach.
君は小言を言う役じゃない
It is not your duty―not for you―to find fault.
日をきめるのは女の役
It is for the lady to name the day.
君は煮る役、僕は食う役
You do the cooking (part), and I will do the eating (part).
君は話し役、僕は聴き役
You do the talking, and I will do the listening.
お役
perfunctory performance of duty
あの学校の先生は授業をお役にやっている
The teachers of that school teach as a matter of duty―The teaching at that school is perfunctory―perfunctorily done.

content: 3. (=芝居の役)a part; a r?le; a character

to play a part―act a part―perform a part―enact a r?le―personate a character

content: 4. (=用)use; service

content.content: 役に立つ
to be useful―of use―serviceable―of service―good for something―to come in useful―serve one's purpose―prove of service―render service―stand one in stead
どんな物でも使いようでそれぞれ役に立つ
Everything is useful in its place―Everything comes in useful.
どんな人でも使いようでそれぞれ役に立つ
Every man is useful in his way.
この植物は何役に立つか
Of what use is the plant?―What is this plant good for?
何か役に立つか
Is it of any use?―good for anything?
何か役に立つだろう
It must be of some use―good for something.
私でお役に立つなら幸いです
I shall be happy to be of service to you.
僕のような者でもいつかお役に立つこともあろう
I may prove of service some day.
女房悦べ、忰がお役に立ったぞや
Rejoice, wife! our boy has proved of service to his lord.
あの男はたいへん役に立ちます
He is very useful―of great use―He proves of great service―He renders me good service.
英語がお役に立った
My English has stood me in good stead.
何でも覚えておけばいつか役に立つこともあろう
The knowledge of anything may stand you in stead some day.
いつか役に立つこともあろうから何でも覚えておくがよい
You should learn anything for some future use―for possible uses.
役に立たぬ
to be useless―of on use―good for nothing
この動物は何の役にも立たぬ
This animal is of no use at all.
あれは役に立たぬ奴だ
He is good for nothing―a good-for-nothing (fellow).
この発明は実際何の役にも立たぬ
This discovery is of no practical use.
こんなことを覚えても何の役にも立たない
It is no use learning such things―It is no good learning such things―There is no use in learning such things―There is no good in learning such things―It does no good to learn such things.
こんなことを学んで何の役に立つか
What is the use of learning such things?―Where is the good of learning such things?
こんなことを学んでも何の役にも立つまいと思う
I do not see the use of learning such things.
ああいう人はイザとなると役に立たない
Such friends will fail you in time of need.
お役に立てる
to put anything in requisition―call anything into requisition―(ご用立ての意味なら)―place anything at one's service―place anything at one's disposal
今度の演習についてどんな百姓屋までもお役に立った
The Manoeuvres have put every peasant's cottage in requisition.
読書がしたくば僕の蔵書をお役に立てる
If you wish to read, I will place my library at your service―my library is heartily at your service.
金が要るならいくらでもご入用だけお役に立てる
If you want money, I shall place at your disposal any sum you may need.

content.content: 先生は教える役目

It is not your duty―not your business―not your province―not your place―not for you―to find fault.

I will act as go-between.
君、審判官の役目をしてくれ給え
You will act as umpire―be umpire―see fair-play.
誰が通弁の役目をするか

亭主の役目をする
to officiate as host―play the host―do the honours of the house

to officiate as hostess―play the hostess―do the honours of the table

この箱が食卓の役目をする
This box serves for―does duty for―a table.
この室が事務所の役目をしている
This room serves as―does duty as―the office.

役目を立てる
to do one's duty―play one's part

そんなことをしては役目が立ちません

(You will excuse me, as) I am only doing my duty―I must do my duty.

あの学校の授業はお役目的だ

content:

〈自動〉
1. To burn

content.content: 家が焼けている

content: 2. (=食物が焼ける)to broil; to roast; to grill; to bake; to toast; to do

content.content: 魚が焼ける
Fish broils.
肉が焼ける

鶏が焼ける

もう焼けたか
Is it done?
まだ焼けない
It is not yet done―not done enough.
魚はよく焼けた方が好い、焼け過ぎたのが好い、こんがり焼けたのが好い

肉は生ま焼けに焼けたのが好い
I like meat underdone.
肉がよく焼けていない
The meat is not done enough.
この肉は好い加減に焼けている
The meat is done to a turn.
この肉は焼け過ぎた
The meat is overdone―burnt to a cinder.
パンが焼ける

餅が焼けた

芋が焼けた
The potatoes have roasted.
日に焼ける
to get sun-burnt―get sun-browned―be browned by the sun―tan
日に焼けた顔
a sun-burnt face―a sun-browned face―a tanned face
顔が日に焼けて真黒だ

content.content: あの男はずいぶん弥次だ

a country-seat
町屋敷
a town-house
化物屋敷
a haunted house
屋敷町
a residential quarter

content: 2. (=邸内)the grounds; the premises; a compound

content.content: 屋敷内に井戸があるか
Is there a well in the grounds?

content: 3. (=外国商館)a foreign firm

content.content: 彼は屋敷の仕事をしている
He works for a foreign firm.

content:
やしない〔養い〕
〈名〉
1. (=芙蓉、給養)keep; sustenance; support; maintenance
2. (=滋養)nourishment; nutrition

content.content: 精神の養い
mental pabulum

content:
3. (=養育)nurture; upbringing
4. (=肥料)manure; dressing

やしなう〔養う〕
〈他動〉
1. (=食物を与える)to feed

content.content: 子どもを匙で養う
to feed a child with spoon
禽獣は子を養う
Birds and beasts feed their young.
家畜を養う
to feed cattle―(飼うの意味なら)―keep cattle

content: 2. (=栄養を与える)to nourish; to sustain

content.content: 食物は身体を養う
Food nourishes the body―sustains nature.
病人は体力を養うだけの食物が取れぬ
The invalid can not take enough food to sustain nature―support nature.

content: 3. (=扶養する)to keep, support, maintain, provide for (a family)

content.content: 子を養う
to feed the little ones―provide for one's family
彼は大勢の子どもを養わにゃならぬ
He has a large family to provide for.
大勢の家族を養っている
He supports a large family―maintains a large family.
彼は百円の給料で家族五人養わにゃならぬ
He must keep a family of five on a salary of 100 yen a month.
彼は自分も養いかねているのにどうして女房など持てるものか
How can he marry when he can hardly keep himself?
子を養うは親の義務
It is the duty of parents to provide for their children.
西洋では子が親を養う義務が無い
In foreign countries, it does not lie upon the son to provide for his aged father.
子どもは親に養って貰う
Children depend on their parents for support.
下男下女を置くは家に賊を養うなり
“So many servants, so many thieves.”
姦婦を養う
to cherish a viper in one's bosom
姦婦を養う夫
a cuckold

content: 4. (=給養する)to supply (an army with provisions); to sustain (an army)

content.content: 大軍を養うだけの食糧がある
There are enough provisions to supply a large army―sustain a large army.

content: 5. (=養育する、教育する)to bring up; to breed; to rear; to raise; to educate

content.content: 子どもを牛乳で養う
to bring up a child on the bottle―bring up a child by the hand
老夫婦は大勢の子どもを養っている
The old couple has raised a large family of children;―reared a large family of children.
子どもに商売を仕込まぬ者は賊を養う
One who brings up one's boy to no trade, breeds a thief.
あの学校は一千名の学生を養う設備がある
The school is equipped to educate 1,000 students.
女子と小人は養い難し
Women and small men are hard to manage.

content: 6. (=療養する)to recuperate (oneself); to recruit (one's health); to convalesce

content.content: 彼は大磯に病を養っている
He is recuperating―recruiting―convalescing at Oiso.

content: 7. (=養子にする)to adopt (a child)

content.content: 彼は藁の上から伯(叔)父に養われた
He was adopted by his uncle as soon as he was born.

content: 8. (=修養する)to cultivate (virtue); to foster (a spirit); to train (the mind); to develop (a power)

content.content: 徳を養う
to cultivate virtue
胆力を養う
to cultivate the powers of manhood
忍耐を養う
to cultivate perseverance
浩然の気を養う
to cultivate a magnanimous spirit (under natural influences)―(遊んでなどなら)―raise one's spirits
好い習慣を養う
to cultivate a good habit―form a good habit
腕力を養う
to develop muscular power
体力を養う
to develop bodily strength
国民の政治思想を養う
to foster political ideas in the people
尚武の気象を養う
to foster a military spirit in the people
読書力を養う
to train the student to read hard authors

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 青年の向上心を養う
to inspire youth with aspiration
公共心を養う
to instil public spirit into one's mind
義侠心を養う
to give free play to noble and generous impulses
鋭気を養う
to raise one's spirits―freshen oneself for work
社会の気風を養う
to give the tone to society
国力を養う
to enrich the national resources
国民の軍事思想を養う
to arouse public interest in military affairs
国民の海事思想を養う
to arouse public interest in maritime affairs

content:
やしゃ〔夜叉〕
〈名〉A demon; a devil

content.content: 外面菩薩の如く内心夜叉の如し
Woman is an angel without, a fiend within―Woman has a fair face, but a foul heart.

やしゃご〔玄孫〕
〈名〉A great-great-grand child ［-grand son, -grand daughter］

content:
やしゅ〔野趣〕
〈名〉Rustic charm; rural charm; idyllic beauty; wild beauty

content.content: この庭は野趣を帯びている
The garden has a rustic flavour―a rural touch―a wild beauty.
この辺は野趣に富んでいる
This neighbourhood is full of rustic charm―full of rural charm.
この絵は巧みに野趣を写している
The painting is a clever representation of idyllic beauty.

content:
やしゅう〔夜襲〕
〈名〉A night attack

content.content: 夜襲を行う
to deliver a night attack on the enemy's position

content:
やじゅう〔野獣〕
〈名〉A wild beast

content.content: 野獣性
bestial nature―bestiality―brutal nature―brutality
あの男は野獣性がある
He is a brutal man.

やしゅうこ〔夜周弧〕
〈名〉The nocturnal arc

content:
やしょく〔夜食〕
〈名〉Supper

content.content: 夜食を食う
to take supper―sup

やじりきり〔家後切〕
〈名〉(事)housebreaking:(人)a housebreaker

content:
やしん〔野心〕
〈名〉
1. (=大望)ambition

content.content: 彼は野心が有る
He is ambitious―He flies high.
野心を懐く
to cherish an ambition―nourish an ambition
彼は法外な野心を懐いている
He cherishes an inordinate ambition.
野心満々
He is full of ambition.
野心矢の如し
He is consumed with ambition.
日本は領土を拡張せんとする野心は無い
Japan has no territorial ambition.
野心家
an ambitious man

content: 2. (=何に対する野心、何を取らんとする野心)designs, sinister designs (upon anything)

content.content: 敵国はこの国に対して野心を懐いている
The enemy has designs upon―harbours sinister designs upon―this territory.
彼はあの地位に野心が有る
He has an eye to the position.
彼は女の財産に野心が有って貰ったのだ
He married her with an eye to her fortune.

content:
やじん〔野人〕
〈名〉A rustic; a boor; a bumpkin

content.content: 野人礼に嫻{なら}わず
Boors have no manners.

content:
やす〔安〕
〈形〉Cheaper

content.content: この口は二円安です
This brand is two yen cheaper―cheaper by two yen.

content:
やす〔魚扠〕
〈名〉A fish-spear; a harpoon; a leister

content.content: 魚扠で魚を突く
to spear a fish

content:
やすあがり〔安上り〕
〈形〉Cheap; economical; inexpensive

content.content: 西洋館は日本造りより安上りだ
A foregin house is cheaper than―more economical than―less expensive than―a Japanese house.
あそこならウンと安上りにいく
It can be done right cheap there.

content:
やすい〔安い〕
〈形〉
1. (=安価の)cheap; low in price; inexpensive; reasonable

content.content: 値(価)が安い
The price is low.
品物が安い
The article is cheap―The article is low in price.
物価が安い
The prices are low.
諸式が安い
The commodities are cheap―The commodities are low in price.
相場が安い
It is low in price.
生活費が安い
The cost of living is low.
家賃が安い
The house-rents are low.
この家は五千円じゃ安い
The house is cheap at 5,000 yen.
その倍でも安いものだ
It would be cheap at twice the price.
ばかに安い
It is dirt-cheap―dog-cheap.
善い物はいくら高くとも安いものだ
A good thing is cheap at any price.
悪い物はいくら安くとも高いものだ
A bad thing is dear at any price.
只ほど安いものは無い
The lowest price you can pay for a thing is to ask for it.
安く買う
to buy cheap―buy at a bargain―make a good bargain
この家は安かった
This house was a good bargain―I had a good bargain in this house.
いくら安くとも買わない
I won't buy it at any price.
安く売る
to sell cheap―sell at a low price―sell at a low figure―sell at a discount―sell at a sacrifice
あの店は安い
They sell cheap at that shop.
それより安くは売られません
I can't take less.
安く買って高く売る
They buy cheap and sell dear.
安くする
to cheapen the article―reduce the price
安くなる
to fall in price―go down in price
入費が安く上がる
The expenses come low.
安く踏む
to rate anything low―estimate the price low
安く踏んでも五十万は有るだろう
He must be worth, at least, 500,000 yen.
安く話が付いた
We have come to terms at a low figure.
安かろう悪かろう
Cheap and nasty.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: ドッコイそう安くは問屋で卸さぬ
“Not so fast!”―“There are two words to that bargain.”
相い惚れとはお安くないね
Reciprocal love is beyond price.
ご夫婦お揃いでお芝居はお安くないね
Going to the play in each other's company? How I envy you!
二人はお安くない仲だ
They are in love with each other.
安くて好いから日本品を使っています
We use Japanese goods for economy's sake.

content: 2. (=安心な、安泰な)easy; peaceful

content.content: 安き心地無し
I feel uneasy―I am ill at ease.
ちと安からぬ心地で世間の様子を見ている
I am observing the state of affairs rather uneasy in mind.
国家を泰山の安きに置く
to secure lasting peace for the country

content:
やすい〔易い〕
〈形〉
1. (=容易)easy; light; simple

content.content: 英語は入りやすく極め難い
English is easy to learn, but hard to master.
この本はわかりやすい
This book is easy to understand.
悪い癖は付きやすく直り難い
Bad habits are easy to get into and hard to get rid of.
得やすきものは失いやすし
“Light come, light go.”
死は易く生は難し
“It is easy to die (for one's faith); it is hard to live (up to one's faith).”
案ずるより生むがやすい
It is easier than one expects.
おやすいご用です
It is no trouble at all.

content: 2. (=何々したがる)apt (to do something); liable (to something); ready (to do something)

content.content: ガラスはこわれやすい
Glass is apt to break―Glass breaks easily.
人は誤りやすい
Man is apt to fall into error―Man is liable to error.
君はあまり信じやすい
You are too ready to believe―You are too credulous.
僕の腹は狂いやすい
My bowels easily get out of order―My bowels are apt to get out of order.

content:
やすうけあい〔安請合い〕
〈名〉A ready promise:(=する) to be ready to promise; to be apt to promise

content.content: 君は安請け合いをするから困る
You are too ready to promise.
安請け合いの早忘れ
“A man apt to promise is apt to forget.”

content:
やすうり〔安売り〕
〈名〉Cheap sale; bargain sale; sacrifice sale:(=する) to sell cheap; to sell at a bargain; to sell at a sacrifice

content.content: 見切り安売り
clearance sale―slaughter sale
閉店に付き見切り大安売り
Great bargains offered at final riddance sale.
安売り日
a bargain day

content:
やすき〔安き〕
〈名〉Peace

content.content: 国家を泰山の安きに置く
to secure lasting peace for the country

content:
やすっぽい〔安っぽい〕
〈形〉Cheap; trashy; tawdry; worthless; insignificant

content.content: 安っぽい男だ
He is a cheap-looking man―an insignificant-looking man.
人を安っぽく見るものでない
You should not hold men cheap.
安っぽい品ばかりだ
There are nothing but trashy articles.
安っぽい装飾はかえって無い方が好い
Tawdry ornaments are better done without.
安っぽい人間だ
He is a worthless man―an insignificant man.

content:
やすどまり〔安泊り〕
〈名〉A cheap lodging-house; a doss-house

content.content: 安泊りに泊る
to doss
安泊りの客
a dosser

content:
やすね〔安値〕
〈名〉A low price; a low figure

content.content: 安値に売る
to sell at a low price―at a low figure―at a discount―at a sacrifice

やすぴかもの〔安ぴか物〕
〈名〉Tinsels; knick-knacks; gewgaws; gimcracks

content:
やすぶしん〔安普請〕
〈名〉Jerry-building

content.content: 貸家は安普請が多い
Houses to let are mostly jerry-built.

content:
やすみ〔休み〕
〈名〉
1. (=休息)rest

content.content: ひと休み休もうじゃないか
Let us take a rest!―have a rest!
お休みのお邪魔をして済みません
I am sorry to intrude on your privacy.

content: 2. (=休憩、中入り)recess

content.content: 十二時から一時まで一時間の休みがある
We have an hour's recess from 12 to 1.

content: 3. (=休暇)a holiday; a vacation:(雇い人のは)an off day:(中途からなら)dismissal

content.content: 万歳(!)今日は休みだ
Hurrah! There is no school today―We have a holiday today.
明日は休みだという掲示が出ている
There is a notice up saying that there is no school tomorrow.
明日は学校を休みましょう
We will close the school tomorrow.
その日はいつも学校は休みになる
The school is always closed on that day.
国葬のあった日には学校は休みになった
The school was closed on the day of the national funeral.
今月の始めから学校は休みになっている
The school has been closed since the beginning of the month.
生徒は休みで国へ帰っている
The students are home for the holidays.
魚河岸は二十二日は休みだ
The fish-market is closed on the 22nd.
日曜は銀行は休みだ
The bank is closed (to business) on Sunday.
休みを貰う
to have a holiday―have a day off
休みを取る
to take a holiday―take a day off
その日は昼から休みになった
We were dismissed for the day at noon.
本日休み
Closed for the day―Closed to business.

content: 4. (=欠席)absence

content.content: 先生は今日休みだ
He is absent today.
休みの多い先生だ
He absents himself very often.
僕は今日は病気休みだ
I am on the sick-list today.
先生は今日は病気で休みだった
He did not meet his classes today on account of illness.

content: 5. (=就眠)going to bed

content.content: もうお休みの時間でしょう
It must be time for you to go to bed.
何時にお休みですか
What time do you go to bed?―retire to repose?
今晩は、もうお休みですか
Good evening! Are you in bed already?
今日は、まだお休みですか
Good morning! Are you still in bed?

content:
やすみやすみ〔休み休み〕
〈副〉
1. With frequent stops; frequently stopping to rest

content.content: 老人は休み休み歩く
The old man walks with frequent stops to rest.
悪口も休み休みに言え
You are constantly abusing me.
冗談も休み休言え
You are constantly joking.

content:
やすむ〔休む〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=休息する)to rest oneself; to repose (oneself); to stop; to take breath; to draw breath

content.content: 職人が休んでいる
The workmen are at rest.
ごゆっくりお休みなさい
Rest yourself at your leisure!
ひと休み休もうじゃないか
Let us take a rest!―have a rest!
ちょっと休もうじゃないか
Let us rest a while!―take a short rest!
ひと息休む
to take a rest―take breath
坂の中腹でひと息休んだ
I took breath when half-way up the slope.
君は疲れたのだから二三日休めば治る
You are only tired. A few days' rest will set you up.
途中で茶屋へ休んだ
We stopped at a tea-house on the road.
老人は休み休み歩く
The old man walks with frequent stops.
一日立ちづめで休む暇が無い
I keep on my legs all day―I am never off my legs.
休めー(号令)
Stand at ease!
休めの姿勢をとる
to stand at ease

content: 2. (=休業する)to rest from labour; to unbend from labour; to lie by; to take a holiday; to make holiday; to take a day off; to close (an office or a school)

content.content: 日曜は業を休む
We rest from labour on Sunday.
たまには勉強を休むがよい
You ought to unbend from work once in a while.
今日は一日休んで遊ぼう
Let us take a holiday―make holiday―take a day off.
一週間ばかり休んで遊びに行こうと思う
I am going to take a week's holiday.
諸官省や諸学校はその日は祝意を表して休んだ
The public offices and schools were closed in honour of the occasion.
流感猖獗{しょうけつ}のため休んだ学校がある
Some schools have closed owing to the prevalence of influenza.
日盛りには仕事を休む
We lie by in the heat of the day.
今日は仕事を休まして戴きたい
I wish to be excused from my duties today.
今日は仕事を休ましてあげる
I will excuse you from your duties today.
土地を休ませる
to allow land to lie fallow

content: 3. (=停止する)to stop; to suspend; to lie idle; to stand idle

content.content: 普請中、業を休みます
We shall stop business―suspend business―close business―during construction.
機械が休んでいる
The machinery is at rest―standing idle.

content: 4. (=欠席する)to be absent (from school); to absent oneself (from school); to stay away (from a meeting); to cut (a lecture)

content.content: 先月いっぱい稽古を休んだ
I was absent from school all last month.
病気のほかはどんなことがあっても学校を休むものじゃない
You should not absent yourself from school―miss school―on any account, unless you are ill.
今日は頭痛がするから学校を休もう
I will not go to school, for I have a headache.
彼は近頃学校を休んでいる
He has not been at school of late.
田中は今日は病気で休んでいる
Tanaka is on the sick-list today.
僕は病気で一年休んだ
I have played away a year.
彼は時々ずるをきめて学校を休む
He often plays truant.
課業を休んで見に行った
I cut my lesson to go to see it.
彼は時々講義を休む
He often cuts the lecture.
僕は英語を休んだことが無い
I never cut my English.

content: 5. (=寝る)to sleep; to go to bed; to retire to repose; to turn in

content.content: 昨夜はよくお休みになりましたか
Have you slept well?―Did you have a good night?
よく休めませんでした
I have not slept well―I had a bad night.
もうお休みになる時間でしょう
It must be time for you to go to bed.
何時にお休みになりますか?
What time do you go to bed?―retire to repose?
今晩は、もうお休みになりましたか
Good evening! Are you in bed already?
今日は、まだお休みになっていますか
Good morning! Are you still in bed?
お休みなさい
Good night!―I wish you sweet dreams!

やすめち〔休め地〕
〈名〉Fallow land

content:
やすめる〔休める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=休息せしむ)to rest; to ease

content.content: 身体を休める
to rest oneself
骨を休める
to rest one's wearied limbs
頭を休める
to give one's brain a rest
手休める
to rest from labour
足を休める暇が無い
I am never off my legs.
目を休める
to rest one's eyes―relieve the eye
心を休める
to set one's heart at ease―set one's mind at rest
土地を休める
to allow land to lie fallow

content: 2. (=休止せしむ)to stop

content.content: 機械を休める
to stop the machinery

content:
やすもの〔安物〕
〈名〉A cheap article; a good bargain

content.content: 安物は高物
“Cheap is dear.”
安物買いの銭失い
“A good bargain is a pick-purse.”

content:
やすやす〔易々〕
〈副〉Easily; with ease; without any effort; without any trouble

content.content: 彼はやすやすと成功する
He succeeds with case.
月満ちてやすやすと産み落としたのが玉の如き男の子
In the fulness of time, she was easily delivered of a gem of a boy.

content:
やすやど〔安宿〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: やすどまり〔安泊り〕

やすらう〔休らう〕
〈自動〉
1. (=休む)to rest
2. (=ためらう)to hesitate

content:
やすらか〔安らか〕
〈形〉Easy; peaceful; calm; tranquil; reposeful

content.content: 安らかに日を送る
to live in peace
彼は隠退して安らかに日を送っている
He lives in tranquil retirement.
安からに眠る
to sleep in peace
安らかに死ぬ
to die a calm death―depart in peace
心安らかならず
I feel uneasy―I am ill at ease.
安からな御世
a peaceful reign

content:
やすり〔安利〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ていり〔低利〕

content:
やすり〔鑢〕
〈名〉A file:(荒目のは)a rasp

content.content: 鑢をかける
to file―rasp―anything
鑢屑
filings
鑢紙
emery-paper―sand-paper

content:
やすんずる〔安んずる〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=安心する)to feel easy; to be at ease; to be in peace

content.content: これを聞いて心を安んじた
The news made me easy―set my heart at ease―set my mind at rest.
心安んぜず
I feel uneasy―I am ill at ease.
万民その堵に安んず
The people can now live in peace.
天下万民を安んずる、これ英雄の志
It is the great man's aim to enable the millions to live in peace.
娠襟{しんきん}を安んじ奉る
to set the Emperor's heart at ease―set the Emperor's mind at rest

content: 2. (=満足する)to be contented (with anything)

content.content: 分に安んずる
to be contented with one's lot
分に安んずる者は幸福なり
He who is contented, is happy.
幸福は分に安んずるにあり
Happiness consists in contentment.
小成に安んずる
to be contented with a little―contented with one's humble lot
僕は学校教員で生涯小成に安んずることにした
I have made up my mind to remain contented with my lot as school-teacher all my life.
彼は現在の地位に安んじている
He is contented with his present position.
君子は逆境に安んず
The wise man is cheerful in adversity.

content:
やせい〔野生〕
〈形〉Wild:(=する) to grow wild

content.content: 昔は日本では米が野生であった
Rice grew wild in ancient Japan.
野生動植物
wild animals―wild plants
南洋では野生果物を食って生きておれる
One might live on wild fruits in the South Sea Islands.

content:

content.content: 痩犬の腹を肥せ
“Feed the birds of the air and the beasts of the field.”

content:

content.content: 痩腕を頼みにする

content:
やせおとろえる〔痩せ衰える〕
〈自動〉To become emaciated; to waste away; to pine away; to peak and pine

content.content: 痩せ衰えた姿
an emaciated figure
病人は痩せ衰えるばかりだ
The invalid is wasting away.
痩せ衰える病
marasmus
彼は痩せ衰える病だ
He suffers from marasmus.
娘は気で気を病んで痩せ衰えるばかりだ
She is eating her heart out.
彼は骨と皮ばかりに痩せ衰えている
He is reduced to a skeleton―worn to a shadow.

content:

content.content: 痩形な人だ

content:

〈名〉Mock-endurance; bravado:(=する) to show bravado; to sham endurance; to make a virtue of necessity

content.content: 痩我慢の強い男だ
He is full of bravado.
武士が清貧を誇ったのも痩我慢さ
The samurai, making a virtue of necessity, gloried in honourable poverty.
そんなことは痩我慢にもできない
I can not, even out of bravado, do that.

content:
やせかれた〔痩せ枯れた〕
〈形〉Lean; thin; spare; wizened

content.content: 痩せ枯れた老人だ

content:
やせぎす〔痩せぎす〕
〈形〉Slim; slight; slender; spare

content.content: 痩せぎすの娘だ
She is a slim girl.
痩せぎすのすらりとした女だ
She is a slender woman―a woman of slender figure.
痩せぎすの男だ
He is a slightly-built man―a man of slight build.
痩せぎすの姿
a ―slight figure―a spare figure

content:
やせる〔痩せる〕
〈自動〉
1. To become thin; to become lean; to lose flesh

content.content: 痩せた
(人)a thin man―(牛や豚)―a lean cow―a lean pig―(姿)―a spare figure
彼は非常に痩せている
He is as thin as a lath.
病気して痩せたのだ
He has lost flesh owing to illness.
痩せても枯れても元が元
“It is not in gold to be oxidized.”
痩せる薬
a remedy for reducing flesh―an antifat cure

content: 2. (=土地が痩せる)to become sterile

content.content: 地痩せて耕作に敵せず
The soil is sterile and unfit for cultivation.

sterile soil―barren soil―poor soil

field-artillery

content.content: 夜前からここに居る
I have been here since last night―I have been here overnight.

content.content: 耶蘇教信者
a Christian

content.content: 八十路の老人
an octogenarian

content:

content.content: 屋台骨が傾く
One's fortune declines.

やたいみせ〔屋台店〕
〈名〉A booth; a stall

content:

〈副〉Eagerly; ardently; impatiently

content.content: 心はやたけに逸れども力無き身の彼を救うに由無し
Eager as I am, I am powerless to save him.
心はやたけに逸れども多勢に無勢如何ともなす能わず
Eager for the fray as we were, there was no fighting against such odds.

〈名〉Random jottings; stray notes

やたらじま〔矢鱈縞〕

content:
やたらに〔矢鱈に〕
〈副〉
1. (=無闇に)immoderately; inordinately; madly; to excess; like fury; like thunder; like hell; like blazes; like the devil; like anything

content.content: 彼はやたらに子どもを可愛がる
He is immoderately fond of his children―He is inordinately fond of his children―He dotes upon his children.
そうやたらに急ぐことはない
There is no occasion for such mad haste.
彼はやたらに食い、やたらに飲む
He eats to excess―drinks to excess―commits excesses.
女が男にやたらに惚れている
She loves him to distraction.
彼はやたらに勉強する
He works like fury―like thunder―like hell―like blazes―like the devil―like anything.
やたらに本を読む
He devours books.

content: 2. (=無差別に)indiscriminately; promiscuously

content.content: (彼は善いのも悪いのもかまわずに)やたらに本を読む
He is an indiscriminate reader.
そうやたらに人を入れては困る
You must not admit people so indiscriminately.
彼はやたらに女に手を付ける
He indulges in promiscuous intercourse with women.
彼はやたらに人を賞める
He lavishes praise on everybody―He is lavish of his praise.
やたらに人をけなす
He condemns people in the gross.
やたらに人を信用する
He will trust everybody.
やたらに人を疑う
He suspects everybody.
彼はやたらに人と交際しない
He is choice of his company.

content: 3. (=軽率に)rashly; recklessly

content.content: やたらに約束するものでない
You should not make rash promises.
彼はやたらに本を書く
He is a reckless writer.
彼は人の言うことをやたらに信ずる
He is too ready to believe―too credulous.
彼はやたらに口を利かない
He is choice of his words.

content: 4. (=当てどなく)at random; at hazard

content.content: 敵は暗闇にやたらに発砲した
The enemy fired at random in the dark.

やち〔谷地〕
〈名〉A marsh; a bog

content:
やちゅう〔夜中〕

content.content: 夜中雪が降った
It has snowed during the night.

やちょ〔野猪〕
〈名〉The wild boar

やちよ〔八千代〕
〈名〉Myriads of ages

content:
やちん〔家賃〕
〈名〉
1. Rent; house-rent:(家賃の上がり高は)rental

content.content: 家賃を払う
to pay the rent―pay for the house
君の家は家賃はいくらか
What do you pay for your house?
家賃を五十円払う
I pay 50 yen for my house.
家賃をいくら取るか
What do they charge you for the house?
家賃を取らん、無家賃だ
They charge me no rent―The house is free of rent―I live rent-free in the house.
彼は家賃が滞っている
He is behindhand with the rent―in arrear with his rent.
三カ月分の家賃が滞っている
Three month's rent is in arrears.
家賃の滞り
rent in arrears―back rent
家賃が上る、家賃が下る
The rent rises―The rent falls.
家賃を上げる、家賃を下げる
to raise the rent―lower the lent
彼は家賃がいくら上がるか
What has he from the rent?―What is his rental?
家賃がだいぶ上がるだろう
He must have a great deal from the house-rent―His rental must amount to a great deal.
家賃が五千円上がる
He has 5,000 yen from the house-rent―His rental amounts to 5,000 yen.

content:
やつ〔奴〕
〈名〉
1. A fellow; a chap

content.content: 悪い奴だ
He is a bad lot.
手におえない奴だ
He is an ugly customer to deal with―an awkward customer to deal with―I have caught a Tartar!
薄情な奴だ
(男なら)He is faithless lover―(女なら)―She is a false fair one.
意地の悪い役だ
He (She) is a spiteful thing.
図々しい奴だ
He is a cool hand―a cool fish.
だらしのない奴だ
He is a loose fish.
うさんな奴だ
He is a suspicious fellow.
果報な奴だ
The lucky dog!―The lucky beggar!
貴様は冥加に余った奴だ
You are a lucky dog―a made man.
不埒な奴め
Wretch!
見るのもいやな奴だ
I can't bear the sight of the fellow.
あんな奴
Such a fellow!―Such a contemptible fellow!―Such a mean fellow!

content: 2. (=事、物)a thing

content.content: よくある奴さ
Such things will happen.
よくやる奴さ
It is a very common mistake―a very common blunder.

content: 〈代名詞〉He; she

content.content: 奴来ている
She is here.
奴に買ってお貰いよ
Get him to buy you one!

content: 〈反復代名詞〉One

content.content: 大きい奴が欲しいのだ
I want a large one.

content:
やつあたり〔八つ当り〕
〈名〉Quarrelling with everybody; falling foul of everybody; running amuck at everybody; snarling at everybody

content.content: 彼は何でも思うようにならないと八つ当たりに当たり散らす
When anything goes wrong with him, he will fall foul of everybody―run amuck at people.

やつおりばん〔八つ折判〕
〈名〉An octavo

content:
やっか〔薬価〕
〈名〉The price of medicine; charge for medicine

content.content: 薬価を払う
to pay the doctor's bill

content:
やっかい〔厄介〕
〈名〉
1. (=面倒、迷惑)trouble; an encumbrance; a burden; a nuisance:(=な) troublesome; cumbersome; burdensome; awkward; plaguy; pestilent; confounded:(=がる) to find (anything) troublesome

content.content: 人に厄介をかける
to give one trouble―put one to trouble
ご厄介を掛けて済みません
I am sorry to put you to trouble.
毎度ご厄介を掛けて済みません
I am sorry to be a constant trouble to you.
あの男は始終警察のご厄介になる
He is constant trouble to the police.
親の厄介になっているのはいやだ
I don't wish to be a burden to my father.
家族があると厄介だ
A family is an encumbrance.
彼は手助けどころかかえって厄介だ
So far from being a help to me, he is a positive encumbrance to me.
彼は家族という厄介がある
He has an encumbrance in the shape of a family―He is encumbered with a family.
彼は子どもを厄介視している
He regards his children as so many encumbrances.
金の無心に来られるのは厄介だ
Requests for money are troublesome.
実に厄介だ
It is a positive nuisance.
税を払うのは厄介だ
The taxes are burdensome.
漢字は覚えるのに厄介だ
The Chinese characters are troublesome to learn.
この道具は扱うに厄介だ
The tool is awkward to handle.
彼は仕事を厄介がっている
He finds his work troublesome―He work bores him.
厄介なことだ
It is a troublesome matter―a plaguy matter―a pestilent piece of business―a nuisance.
厄介な仕事だ
It is a confounded task.
試験は厄介だなー
Confound the examination!
厄介な奴だ
He is a troublesome fellow.
仕事をせずに金ばかり使って厄介な奴だ
A pretty fellow, to do no work and do nothing but spend money!
厄介な貰い物
a white elephant
厄介を払う
to get rid of trouble
厄介を払ってまず安心
I am well rid of the trouble.
厄介の払い納めだ
It is a final riddance.

content: 2. (=依頼)dependence

content.content: 人の厄介になる
to depend on others
子が親の厄介になるのは当たり前だ
It is quite natural that a child should depend on its parents.
貴様はまだ親の厄介になっているか
Are you still dependent on your father?
もう親の厄介になっている年じゃない
You are too old to be dependent on your father.
僕はいつまでも親の厄介になっていられません
I can not be dependent on my father―a burden to my father―for ever.
できるなら親の厄介になりたくない
I do not wish to be dependent on my father―a burden to my father―if I can help it.
早く親の厄介にならないようにしたいものだ
I am anxious to be independent of my father.
あの人は人の厄介にならない
He does not depend on others―He is independent.
僕は厄介になることは嫌いだ
I hate to depend on others―I love independence.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 親が死んでから伯(叔)父の家に厄介になっております
I have lived with my uncle since my father died.
当分この家に厄介になっております
I live with the family for the present.
人の家に厄介になる
to live with one―impose upon one's hospitality
人の家に厄介になるのは心苦しい
It goes against my conscience to impose upon people's hospitality.
それではご厄介になりましょう
Then I shall accept your hospitalities.
この上ご厄介になっては済まないから
I should be sorry to impose upon your hospitality any more.
町内の厄介になる(養老院に入る)
to become a charge upon the parish―come upon the parish
彼は友達の厄介になっている
He subsists upon the bounty of his friends.
どうせしまいには俺の厄介になるのだ
They come upon my hands―come to me―in the end.
お薬の厄介になる
to take to physic
医者の厄介になる
to go to the doctor
これしきのことで医者の厄介になって堪まるものか
How can I go to the doctor for such a trifle?
いつかは刑務所のご厄介になる奴だ
He will come to the gallows in time.

content: 3. (=世話)obligations; goodness; kindness

content.content: あの人には厄介になった
He has been good to me―I lie under obligations to him.
このたびはご厄介になりました
Thank you for your kindness!―I am obliged to you for your goodness―You have laid me under an obligation.
あの婦人には病気中厄介になった
She was good to me in my illness.
病気中はひと方ならぬご厄介になりました
Thank you for your great goodness during my illness.
僕は人の厄介になることは嫌いだ
I have to lie under obligations.

content:
やっかいばらい〔厄介払い〕

content.content: 厄介払いをする
to get rid of trouble―rid oneself of trouble
厄介払いをしてまず安心
I am well rid of the trouble.
厄介払いの仕納めだ
It is a final riddance.

content:
やっかいもの〔厄介者〕

content.content: 町内の厄介者だ

to come upon the parish

content:
やっかいもの〔厄介物〕
〈名〉An encumbrance; a burden; a nuisance

content.content: 彼は手助けどころかかえって厄介物だ
So far from being a help to me, he is a positive encumbrance to me.
彼は家族という厄介物がある
He has an encumbrance in the shape of a family―He is encumbered with a family.
あの男は全く厄介者だ
He is a positive nuisance.
誰か厄介物を引き受けてくれないか
Will any one take this burden off my hands?

〈名〉An official interpreter

content:
やっき〔躍起〕

content.content: 躍起となる
to get excited―grow warm―become heated―become hot―bristle up
先方は躍起となっている
The other party is excited.
躍起となってしゃべってる
He is talking in excitement.
二人は躍起となって議論をした

そう躍起となって弁解することはない
You need not be at the trouble of explaining yourself with such warmth.
皆躍起となって改革運動をしている

躍起運動

やつぎばやに〔矢継早に〕

content.content: 矢継早に命令を発した

やっきょう〔薬莢〕

やっきょく〔薬局〕

content.content: 医者の薬局

pharmacopoeia

content:
やっこ〔奴〕

1. (=下男、下郎、奴隷)a servant; a clown; a slave

content: 2. (=やつ)a fellow

やっこどうふ〔奴豆腐〕

content:
やつざきにする〔八つ裂きにする〕

content.content: たとい八つ裂きにされても知らぬことは言えぬ
No torture can make me say what I do not know.
八つ裂きの刑
to be hanged, drawn and quartered

content:
やつす
〈他動〉
1. (=身をやつす、変装する)to disguise oneself (as something); to masquerade (as something)

content.content: 一行は山伏に身をやつした
The party disguised themselves as travelling monks.
一行は山伏に身をやつしておった
The party was disguised as monks.
義経は山伏に身をやつして東へ落ちた
Yoshitsune fled to the East disguised as a monk―under the guise of a monk.
その床屋は身をやつした将校であった
The hair-dresser was a disguised officer―an officer in disguise.
身をやつして世を渡る
to sail under false colours
うきみ〔憂き身〕

content:
』
〈自動〉(=めかす)to dress finely; to dress smartly

content.content: あの女はたいそうやつしている
She is smartly dressed.
彼はやつし屋だ
He is a dandy―a fop―a dude―a swell.

content:
やっつける〔やっ付ける〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=遣る)to do (anything); to go at it

content.content: 猛烈にやっつけろ
Go at it tooth and nail!

content: 2. (=片づける)to make an end of (one's work); to despatch (one's business)

content.content: (結婚か何か)とうとうやっつけやした
I've despatched the business at last.

content: 3. (=なぐる、しかる、いじめる)to give it one

content.content: ひどくやっつけてやった
I gave it him hot.

content: 4. (=殺す)to dispatch; to make away with (one); to do for (one)

content.content: やっつけてしまえ
Away with him!―Down with him!

やつで〔八つ手〕
〈名〉A garden shrub with large hand-like leaves (Fatsia japonica)

content:
やってくる〔遣って来る〕
〈自動〉To come; to appear; to make one's appearance; to put in an appearance

content.content: 彼はいつも同じ時刻にやって来る
He always appears at the same time of day.
もうやって来そうなものだ
It is time he made his appearance.
ちと遅蒔きにやって来た
He put in an appearance rather late in the day.
田中がやって来た
Here is Tanaka!
その夕方友人達がぼつぼつやって来た
Some friends dropped in―blew in―in the evening.
内地雑居になったら外人がどやどややって来るだろうと恐れた人があった
It was feared that, when mixed residence went into operation, foreigners would deluge the country.

content:
やってしまう〔遣って了う〕
〈他動〉To finish; to get through with (one's task)

content.content: この仕事は今日中にやってしまわなければならぬ
I must get my work finished in the course of the day.
今日の仕事をやってしまった
(英国では)I have finished my day's work―(米国では)―I am through for today.

content:
やってのける〔遣って退ける〕
〈自他動〉To accomplish (anything); to manage (anything)

content.content: 彼はあっぱれ見事にやってのけた
He has acquitted himself to his credit―succeeded to admiration.
彼はどんなことでもやってのける
He is equal to any occasion.
どんな難局に遭遇しても立派にやってのける
He is equal to any occasion―He will rise to the occasion.
何事もうまくやってのける
He manages matters with tact.
同じ筆法でやってのけた
I disposed of the matter in the same way.

content:
やってみる〔遣って見る〕
〈自動〉To try; to make a trial; to attempt; to make an attempt

content.content: 一つやってみよう
I will make a trial―have a try at it.
僕にできるだろうかやってみよう
I will see if I can.
やってみればできるのだ
I find on trial that I can do it.
幾度も幾度もやってみ給え
Keep on trying!
やってみても駄目だ
It is no use trying.
一つ雑誌をやってみようと思う
I am going to try my hand at a magazine.
一か八かやってみよう
I will take my chance―take the chances―chance it―take the risks―risk it.
伸るか反るかやってみよう
Sink or swim, I will try.

content:
やってゆく〔遣って行く〕
〈自動〉To get along

content.content: どうかこうかやっていける
I can manage to get along―I can rub along somehow.
この給料でやっていけるか
Can you get along on this salary?―put up with this salary?―make shift with this salary?
助手無しにはやっていけない
I can not do without―manage without―make shift without―an assistant.

content:
やっと
〈副〉
1. (=遂に)at last; at length; finally; now

content.content: 騒動がやっと静まった
The disturbance has at length subsided.
問題がやっと解決した
The matter is settled at last.
彼を幾度も訪ねて今日やっと会った
I called on him several times, and at last saw him today.
彼はやっと卒業した
He has finished school at last.
彼は幾度も幾度もやってやっと成功した
He tried again and again, till he finally succeeded.
やっとわかった
Now I see.
彼が泥棒であったことがやっとわかった
I now find him to have been the thief.

content: 2. (=辛うじて)with difficulty; with much ado; barely; narrowly; just

content.content: やっと成功した
I succeeded with great difficulty―with much ado.
彼はやっと目的を遂げた
He barely accomplished his purpose.
やっと遁れた
I had a narrow escape.
彼はやっと死を免れた
He barely escaped death―He narrowly escaped death―He was snatched from the jaws of death.
来会者はやっと百人に達した
The attendants barely reached a hundred.
彼はやっと当選した
He was elected by a bare majority.
やっとその日を送っている
He makes a bare living.
(眠くて)やっと目を覚ましておった
I kept awake with much ado―I had much ado to keep awake―It was all I could do to keep awake.
やっと借金だけはせずにいる
I have much ado to keep out of debt―It is all I can do to keep out of debt.
彼らはやっと飢渇をしのいでいる
They have much ado to keep off starvation―It is all they can do to keep off starvation―They barely manage to keep the wolf from the door.
汽車にやっと間に合った
I was just in time for the train.
給料は生活にやっと間に合う
My salary barely suffices for my living.
議案がやっと両院を通過した
The bill barely passed both houses.
爪立ちになってやっと届く窓だ
You can just reach the window by standing on tiptoe.
僕はやっと天井に手が届く
I can just reach the ceiling.
彼はやっと十代を越したばかりだ
He is barely out of his teens―scarcely out of his teens.
瞳をこらしてやっと見える
You can just see it by straining your eyes.
やっとのことでできる
I can just manage it.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼はやっとのことで試験だけは通過する
He scrapes through his examinations.
やっと一睡を食った
I snatched a wink of sleep.
やっとの思いでどうかこうかここまで漕ぎつけた
I have struggled through somehow.
滑ったり転んだりしてやっと付いて行った
I stumbled after him as best I might.

〈自動〉To become haggard; to become care-worn

content.content: やつれた顔
a haggard face―a care-worn face
彼はどんな苦労をしたものか見る影も無くやつれている
Care has worn him to a shadow.
彼のやつれた様子から察するとよほど苦労をしたらしい
Judging form his haggard looks, he seems to have gone through much.
こうもやつれるものかいな
Has care such power to ravage a once-beautiful face?
彼はやつれ果てて昔の面影が無い
He is a ruin―the ruin of his former self―a wreck―the wreck of what he was―a mere shadow of what he used to be.

〈名〉
1. (=宿泊)lodging

content.content: 一夜の宿を乞う
to ask for a night's lodging
一夜の宿を貸す
to accommodate one with a night's lodging―give one a night's shelter―put one up for the night
一夜の宿を貸し給え
Can you accommodate me with a night's lodging?―Will you give me a night's shelter?
お気の毒ですがお宿をすることができません
I am sorry we can not accommodate you―put you up.

content: 2. (=宿泊所)lodgings; quarters; an inn; a hotel

content.content: 宿をきめる
to take up one's lodgings―take up one's quarters
学校のじき近くに宿をきめました
I have taken up my quarters close by the school.
宿を取る
to put up at an inn―put up at a hotel
どこへ宿を取るか
Where are you going to put up?
停車場前の旅館に宿を取ろう
Let us put up at the hotel in front of the station.
ここにお宿を取っておいでですか
Are you stopping in the house?
停車場前に宿を取っております
I am staying at a hotel in front of the station.
宿を変える
to change one's lodgings―change one's quarters

家へ下がる

女中は宿へ下がっている

ばくち宿
a gambling-house―a gambler's den

〈他動〉To engage (a teacher); to employ (a man); to hire (a workman); to take (a maid) into one's service; to secure the services of (a guide); to retain (a lawyer); to charter (a ship)

content.content: 教師を雇う
to engage a teacher
教師を一人雇いたい
I wish to secure the services of a teacher―I need the services of a teacher.
本校では西洋人を三人雇っておきます
We employ―retain the services of―three foreigners.
彼らは僕が雇っておくのだ
They are in my service―in my employ―in my pay.
職人を雇う
to hire a workman
彼は職人を百人も雇っておく
He keeps no less than a hundred workmen.
(日光へ行って)案内者を雇った
We secured the services of a cicerone to show us over the temples.
女中を雇う
to take a girl into one's service
女中があなたに雇って戴きたいと言います
She wishes to enter your service.
雇ってくれと言う
to offer one's services
私を雇って戴きたい
I offer my services―I wish to enter your service.
英語の教師にお雇い下さい
I offer my services as teacher of English.
西洋人を雇うので今交渉中だ
I am negotiating with a foreigner for his services.
弁護士を雇う
to retain a lawyer
船を雇う
to charter a ship―(小舟なら)―take a boat
旅人はこの村で馬を雇って山を越す
The traveller takes horse at this village to cross the mountain.
月いくらで(月ぎめで)人を雇う
to engage a man by the month
自動車は一日いくらで雇えるか
Can a motor-car be hired by the day?
一日いくらで雇えるか
What is the hire for a day?
彼は支那へ雇われて行った
He has been engaged in China.
あの人はある会社に雇われている

彼女は家庭教師に雇われて行った

我々はあの人に雇われているのだ
We are in his service―in his employ.
あなたに雇われたらウンと働きます
If I enter your service,―If you take me into your service,―I will work very hard.
あの会社に雇われたがっている者がたくさんある
Many people with to enter the service of that company.

2.

content.content: 健全なる精神は健全なる身体に宿る
A sound mind dwells in a sound body―“Sound mind in sound body.”
正直の頭に神宿る
God dwells in an honest heart.
子どもが腹に宿る
A child enters the womb.
月影が花に宿る
The moon light falls on a flower―sleeps on a flower.
萩の戸の花に
How sweetly sleeps the moonlight soft
宿れる月影は
On mine idyllic flowers!
賤が垣根も
Yet no less sweetly must it fall
隔てざるらん
Upon the humble bowers.

いつも柳の下に鰌はいない

The house is roofed with shingles―shingled.

content: 2. (=矢飛白)arrow-feather pattern (on girl's dress)

やはり〔矢張〕
〈副〉
1. (=また、同様に)likewise; too; (not) either

content.content: 僕もやはりそうです
So it is with me, too.
僕もやはり行きました
I have been there, too.
僕もやはり行きません
I have not been there, either.
やはり僕も見た
I have seen it, too.
やはり僕も見ない
I have not seen it, either.
これもやはり外国製だ
This is likewise foreign.
これもやはり日本製じゃない
This is not Japanese, either.
君も好きか、僕もやはり好きだ
You like it? So do I―You are fond of it? So am I.
君も買ったね、やはり僕も買った
You have bought? So have I.
君も酒は嫌いじゃないね、僕もやはり嫌いじゃない方だ
You are no enemy to wine? Nor am I―Neither am I―No more am I―Nor I either.
君にもできないか、僕にもやはりできないよ
You can not do it? Nor can I―Neither can I―No more can I―Nor I either.
彼の子息も学問が好きだが手前どもの伜もやはり学問が好きで
His son is fond of study, and so is mine―His son has an inclination for study, and so has mine―His son takes kindly to his books, and so does mine.

content: 2. (=それにもかかわらず、しかし)but; still; nevertheless; none the less; for all that; after all; all the same:(前置詞に訳せば)notwithstanding; in spite of; for all; with all; after all

content.content: またやってみたがやはり駄目だった
I tried again, but failed―I tried again, only to fail.
乞食でもやはり命が惜しいと見える
A beggar still clings to life.
温かくともやはり冬は冬だ
Warm as it is, winter is still winter.
なるほど彼は悪辣手段は用いるがしかしやはり政治家は政治家で泥棒ではない
He is unscrupulous, it is true, but still he is a politician, and not a robber.
やはり僕の思った通りだ
I was right, after all.
やはり僕の思い違いであった
I was wrong, after all.
こう言うとおかしいようだがやはり真理だ
Strange as it may sound, it is true for all that.
彼はいくら医者に止められてもやはり相変わらず飲んでいる
He is warned by his doctor, but he keeps on drinking all the same.
彼は欠点は有るがしかしやはり可愛い
He has faults, but I love him none the less―I do not love him the less for his faults―He has faults, nevertheless I love him.
彼は欠点は有るけれどもやはり偉い
With all his faults, he is a great man.
彼はあれほど金が有ってもやはり満足しない
For all his wealth, he is not contented.
彼はあんなに勉強してもやはり失敗した
He failed after all his labours.
彼は病気でもやはり勉強を止めない
He keeps on working notwithstanding his illness―in spite of his illness.
手に取るな
Take not in your hand,
やはり野に置け
But leave her where you found
蓮華草
The flower of low ground!

やはん〔夜半〕
〈名〉Midnight:(=に) at midnight

content:
やばん〔夜番〕
〈名〉(事)watch; night-watch:(人)a night-watchman

content.content: 夜番をする
to keep watch
玄関番の書生がかわるがわる夜番をする
The door-boys keep watch by turns―take turns in keeping watch.

content:
やばん〔野蛮〕
〈名〉Barbarism; barbarity; savagery:(=な) barbarous; barbaric; savage; wild; rude

content.content: 野蛮な風俗
barbarous customs―savage manners
日本の風俗を野蛮だと言って笑わなくなった
They have ceased to ridicule Japanese customs as barbarous.
何かというと腕力を出す、野蛮な奴だ
What a savage―What a barbarian―to resort to force on the least provocation!
そんな野蛮な真似は止せ
No more of such barbarities!
土人はいまだ野蛮な状態にある
The natives are still in a barbarous state―in a savage state.
その国は野蛮状態を脱したばかりだ
They have just risen above barbarism―emerged from savagery.
野蛮人
a barbarian―a savage
野蛮国
a barbarous country―a savage land
野蛮時代
barbarous times―barbaric days

やばんこく〔野蛮国〕
〈名〉A barbarous country; a savage land

やばんじん〔野蛮人〕
〈名〉A savage; a barbarian

content:
やひ〔野鄙〕
〈形〉Vulgar; coarse; gross; boorish; unrefined

content.content: 野鄙な人だ
He is a vulgar man―a man of coarse fibre.
野鄙な言葉を使う
He uses vulgar language―coarse language―gross language.
嗜味が野鄙だ
He has unrefined tastes―vulgar tastes―boorish tastes.

content:
やぶ〔藪〕
〈名〉A bush; a jungle; a thicket; a scrub

content.content: 竹藪
a bamboo grove
藪のような頭をしている
He has bushy hair―matted hair―unkempt hair.
藪から棒に言う
to say anything abruptly
藪をつついて蛇を出す
to wake a sleeping dog
藪をつついて蛇を出すな
Let sleeping dogs lie!―Let well alone!
彼は藪をつついて蛇を出すばかだ
He can not let well alone.

やぶいしゃ〔藪医者〕
〈名〉A quack (doctor); a medicaster; a mountebank; a charlatan; an empiric

やぶいり〔藪入り〕
〈名〉A servants' holiday; an apprentices' holiday

やぶか〔藪蚊〕
〈名〉A large kind of mosquito (found in thickets―culex dives)

やぶからぼうに〔藪から棒に〕
〈副〉Abruptly

content:
やぶさか〔吝〕
〈形〉Miserly; stingy; niggardly

content.content: 吾人は彼を賞むるに吝ならず
We do not grudge him due praise.
余は過ちを改むるに吝ならず
I am ready to amend my fault.

content:
やぶにらみ〔藪睨み〕
〈名〉Squint; strabismus:(=の) squint; squint-eyed; cross-eyed; skew-eyed

content.content: あの人は藪睨みだ
He squints―looks asquint―He is squint-eyed―cross-eyed.
ちょいと藪睨みの気味がある
He has a cast of the eye.
ひどい藪睨みだ
He looks nine ways at once.

content:
やぶへび〔藪蛇〕
〈名〉Waking a sleeping dog

content.content: 藪蛇を出すな
Let sleeping dogs lie!―Let well alone!
彼は藪蛇を出すばかだ
He can not let well alone.

やぶみ〔矢文〕
〈名〉A letter tied to an arrow (sent over castle walls)

content:
やぶる〔破る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=裂く)to tear; to rend

content.content: 着物を破る
to tear one's clothes
彼は着ている着物をビリビリ破った
He ripped up his clothes.
その手紙をふんだくって細々に破ってしまった
I snatched the letter and tore it to pieces.
手帳の紙を一枚破って取った
I tore a leaf out of my note-book.

content: 2. (=破壊する)to break

content.content: 門を破る
to break a gate open
牢を破る
to break prison―break jail―break out of prison―break out of jail
土蔵を破る
to break into a godown
敵陣を破る
to break through the enemy's line
囲みを破る
to break through the besieging army―cut one's way through the besieging army
封鎖を破る
to run a blockade
非常線を破る
to break through a police cordon
犬が垣を破って入った
A dog broke through the fence.
記録を破る
to break the record
平和を破る
to break the peace―disturb the peace
夢を破る
to disturb one's repose
瞑想を破る
to disturb one's meditations
静粛を破る
to break the silence
単調を破るものが無い
There is nothing to break the monotony―nothing to relieve the monotony.

content: 3. (=犯す)to break, infringe, violate, transgress, contravene, offend against, trespass against (the law); to break, violate (the rule or regulation)

content.content: 法を破る
to break the law―infringe the law―violate the law
規則を破る
to break the regulation―violate the rule
文法を破る
to break the rules of grammar―use bad grammar―commit solecism―break Priscian's head
約を破る
to break one's promise
条約を破る
to break a treaty
誓いを破る
to break a vow―(禁酒の誓いなら)―break the pledge
城下の盟を破る
to break faith―violate faith―with a Power
操を破る
to lose one's chastity―stray from the path of virtue

content: 4. (=打破する)to explode (a theory); to break down (a custom); to shatter (an illusion, etc.)

content.content: 旧説を破る
to explode an old theory―knock an old theory on the head
旧弊を破る
to break down conservative ideas
旧習を破る
to break down old customs
迷夢を破る
to shatter an illusion
誤謬を破る
to explode a fallacy

content: 5. (=敵を破る)to defeat (the enemy); to rout (the enemy); to put (enemy) to rout

content.content: 敵に出会してさんざんにこれを破った
We fell in with the enemy, and routed them―put them to the rout.
日軍は戦うごとに敵を破った
The Japanese defeated the enemy at every battle.

content: 6. (=計を破る)to baffle, baulk, defeat, foil, frustrate (one's design)

content.content: 敵の計画を破った
We baffled―baulked―defeated―foiled―frustrated―the enemy in his design.
事を破る
to spoil the game―fail
短気は事を破る
A hot-tempered man is liable to failure.

content:
やぶれ〔破れ〕
〈名〉A rent; a tear

content.content: 着物の破れを繕う
to mend a rent in the clothes

content:
やぶれ〔敗れ〕
〈名〉Failure

content.content: 少しの不注意から事の敗れを来した
A little carelessness brought on a failure.

content:
やぶれかぶれ〔破れかぶれ〕
〈名〉Desperation:(形容詞に用いれば)desperate

content.content: もうこうなりゃ破れかぶれだ
Since things have come to this, I am desperate.
君にそうされりゃ僕は破れかぶれになる
You drive me to desperation.
隠すに隠されず破れかぶれで通した
I could not conceal the fact, and so I determined to brazen it out.

content:
やぶれる〔破れる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=裂ける)to tear, be torn; to rend, be rent

content.content: 君の着物が破れている
Your clothes are torn.
破れた着物
torn clothes
神殿の幕が二つに破れた
“The veil of the temple was rent in twain.”
字書がボロボロに破れている
My dictionary is worn to tatters.
ボロボロに破れた本
a tattered volume

content: 2. (=破裂する)to burst; to break, be broken; to be broken off

content.content: 風船が破れる
A balloon bursts.
腫れ物が破れる
A tumour breaks.
敵線は一回の突撃で破れた
The enemy's line broke at the first charge.
平和が破れる
Peace is broken―Peace is disturbed.
談判が破れた
The negotiations are broken off.

content:
やぶれる〔敗れる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=敗北する)to be defeated; to suffer a defeat; to sustain a defeat; to meet with a reverse; to be routed, be put to rout

content.content: ロシア軍は戦うごとに敗れた
The Russians were defeated at every battle.
仏軍が幾度も敗れた
The French met with many reverses.
賊軍がさんざんに敗れた
The rebels were routed―put to rout.

content: 2. (=失敗する)to fail; to be baffled, be baulked, be defeated, be foiled, be frustrated (in one's design)

content.content: 裏切りした者があったために事が敗れた
The scheme failed owing to treachery.
油断が往々事の敗れたる原だ
Security is often the cause of failure.
敵の計略が敗れた
The enemy were baffled in their design―baulked in their design―defeated in their design―foiled in their design―frustrated in their design.

content:
やぶん〔夜分〕
〈名〉Night; evening:(=に) at night; in the evening

content.content: 夜分にでもお話しにお出でなさい
Come for a chat of an evening!

content:
やぼ〔野暮〕
〈形〉Awkward, uncouth, boorish, rustic (manners); awkward, ungainly, gawky (figure); vulgar (tastes); pedantic (scholar); uncompromising, unaccommodating, rigid (moralist); old-fashioned, unfashionable (ideas); unromantic, unpoetical, prosaic, stale (custom, etc.)

content.content: 細君は野暮な田舎者だ
His wife is an awkward rustic―an uncouth rustic.
風{ふう}が野暮だ
She has awkward manners―uncouth manners―boorish manners―rustic manners.
姿が野暮だ
She has an awkward figure―an ungainly figure―a gawky figure.
作りが野暮だ
She is vulgarly got up.
熱心は野暮の極みだと俗人は言わん
The lukewarm man of the world will say that enthusiasm is the height of vulgarity.
学問を見せびらかすのは野暮だ
It is bad form to parade one's learning.
今時、忠君愛国を説くのは野暮だ
It is unfashionable now to talk of patriotism and loyalty.
野暮な三々九度を止して自由結婚と出かけるお嬢さん達がいまに多くなる
Many a young lady will soon be going in for free marriage, instead of following the stale custom.
言うだけ野暮だ
That goes without saying―You had better leave it unsaid―No one would take you for anything but what you are.
野暮を言う
to be pedantic―unaccommodating―uncompromising
野暮を言わずに世間並みにしようじゃないか
Let us, for once, cease to be pedantic, and follow the world!
野暮を言わずに付き合い給え
Be accommodating for this once, and come with me!
野暮助、野暮天
a boor―a rustic―a gawk―a pedant―a rigid moralist
あの男は野暮だから外交官には向かない
He is too rigid a moralist to make a good diplomat.
野暮で変通が利かない
He is too much of a pedant to adapt himself to new conditions.
そんなことを知らんとは野暮な男だね
What a boor not to know that!
わたしゃ粋を利かして場をはずしているのにお前さん達はなんて野暮な人達だろうね
I discreetly keep out of the way, and you―what gawks you are!

content:
やほう〔野砲〕
〈名〉A field-gun; a field-piece

content.content: 野砲兵
field-artillery―(一人なら)―a field-artilleryman
野砲隊
a field-artillery corps

content:
やま〔山〕
〈名〉
1. A mountain:(固有名詞に伴えば)mount:(小山は)a hill

content.content: 霧島山
Mount Kirishima.
山がそびえる
A mountain rises.
山の頂上
the summit of a mountain―the top of a hill
山の麓
the foot of a mountain―the foot of a hill
山の裾
the skirts of a mountain
山が裾を引く
A mountain sweeps.
山の奥
the recesses of a mountain
山の中
among the mountains
山中の一軒家
a solitary cottage among the mountains
山中の一小村
a hamlet nestling among the mountains
山を登る
to climb a mountain―ascend a mountain―make an ascent of a mountain―go up a hill
船頭多くして船、山に登る
“Too many cooks spoil the broth.”
山を下る
to descend a mountain―go down a hill
山を越える
to cross a mountain
馬で山を越える
to ride across a mountain
軍勢を率いて山を越える
to lead an army across a mountain
その村はあの山を越えたところだ
That village lies beyond that mountain.
高い山
a high mountain―a lofty mountain
父母の恩は山よりも高く海よりも深し
Our debt to our parents is higher than the mountain and deeper than the sea.
山高きをもって貴からず木あるをもって貴しとす
A mountain is valuable, not because it is high, but because it is wooded.
山の方は雪だろう
It will be snowing on the mountains.
山が崩れる
A mountain crumbles down.
山が崩れても動かぬ(女は尻が重い)
She will not budge an inch.
そこまで山続きだ
The mountains form a chain.
日本は山が多い
Japan is a mountainous country.
山また山
There are mountains on mountains.
月が山の端から出る
The moon comes out from behind a mountain.
月が山の端に入る
The moon goes down behind a mountain.
山の空気は薬だ
Mountain air is bracing.
木葉凋落して山骨を現す
The trees have shed their leaves, and the hills are left in their naked glory.
金銀は山から掘る
Gold and silver are dug out of the bowels of the earth.
塵積もって山となる
Dust amassed will make a mountain―“Many a pickle makes a mickle.”
寝て食えば山も空し
Idleness will consume a mountain of wealth.
山のように積み上げる
to pile up anything mountain high
山のような波(山なす波)が頂上にかぶさってきた
A mountain of a wave came falling over my head.
仕事は山ほどある
I have mountains of work to get through.
ご馳走は山ほどある
There are a power of good things―The boards groan under the dishes.
礼状山の如し
Letters of thanks pour in from all quarters.
力山を抜く
He has a mountain-hurling power―a Herculean strength.
仁者は山を楽しみ智者は水を楽しむ
Character rejoices in rest and peace, genius in motion and activity.
末は野となれ山となれ
It may go to the devil for all I care.
海に千年山に千年という代物だ
She is an old campaigner―an old stager.
海のものとも山のものともわからぬ
It is neither flesh nor fish―It is uncertain―It is a matter of uncertainty.

content: 2. (=森林)a forest

content.content: 山から木を伐り出す
to cut down lumber from the forest―lumber

content: 3. (=鉱山)a mine

content.content: 彼は山を買って儲け出した
He made a fortune by investing in mines.

content: 4. (=堆積)a heap; a pile; a lot

content.content: 塵芥の山
a heap of rubbish
山に積んだ金貨
a pile of gold coins
金を山に積まれてもそんなことをするのはいやだ
I would not do such a thing for all the gold in the world.
ひと山いくらで売る
They are sold by the lot.
あんな奴らはひと山百文だ
Such men are beneath notice―unworthy of consideration.
死屍累々として山を成す
The bodies lay in heaps.
死人の山を築いてみせる
I will strew the ground with corpses.
入口は人の山だ
There is a crowd of people at the entrance.
車に山と荷を積む
to load a cart high
山と荷を積んだ車
a high-laden cart

content: 5. (=帽子の山)the crown (of a hat)

content.content: 山の高い帽子、山の低い帽子
a high-crowned hat―a low-crowned hat

content: 6. (=投機、冒険)speculation(略して―spec); a venture; a risk

content.content: ひと山やってみよう
I will take risks―risk it―take the chances―chance it―take my chance.
山をやる
engage in speculation―make a venture―run a risk
山が当たった
The speculation has turned out well.
山がはずれた
The speculation has failed.
山が大当たり
The speculation has turned out a bonanza.
山のことだから当たりはずれがある
There is no saying how a speculation may turn out―A speculation is liable to failure.
山を当てる
to make a hit in speculation―make a good venture
彼は山を当てて身代をこしらえた
He has made a fortune by speculation.
山で身代をつぶした
He has lost his fortune in speculation.
山で買ってみたのだ
I bought on spec―at a venture.
山を張る
to try one's luck―take one's chance
危ない山を張る
to run a risk
試験に山をかける
to risk an examination―hazard an examination―chance an examination

content: 7. (=終局、極点)the end; the climax

content.content: 日本海の海戦で戦争の山が見えた
The Battle of the Japan Sea brought the war to an end.
この一章が話の山だ
This chapter forms the climax of the story―The story comes to a climax in this chapter.

content: 〈接頭詞〉(=野生)wild

content.content: 山葡萄
wild grapes
山桜
the wild cherry

やまあい〔山間〕
〈名〉A ravine; a gorge

やまあらし〔山荒〕
〈名〉The porcupine

content:
やまい〔病〕
〈名〉
1. A disease; a malady; a complaint; an ailment; a disorder; an affection; an infirmity; an evil; an ill; illness; sickness; indisposition:(獣の病)a distemper

content.content: 病を得る
to fall ill―(は英、米は)―fall sick
病にかかる
to contract a disease―to be attacked with a disease―seized with an illness―taken ill
病を患える
to suffer from a disease
彼は病を患えている
He is suffering from a disease―afflicted with a disease.
病を起こす、病が起きる
to have an attack of disease
病が発する
A disease declares itself.
病を発する
to develop a disease
病を治す
to cure a disease―(普通の構文は)―cure one of a disease
病が治る
A disease is cured―One is cured of a disease―One recovers from an illness―One gets well.
病を知るは治るに近し
“To know the disease is half the cure”―“The knowledge of the disease is half the battle.”
病にかかって死ぬ
to die of a disease
この病にかかって死ぬ者がある
Some people die of this disease―Some cases of this disease prove fatal.
病に斃れる
to succumb to a disease
病を養う
to recuperate (oneself)―recruit (one's health)―convalesce
彼は大磯に病を養っている
He is recuperating―recruiting―convalescing―at Oiso.
彼は病の床に臥している
He lies on a bed of illness―He is laid up with an illness―He is ill abed.
病の徴候
the symptoms of a disease
病は膏盲に入っている
The disease is deep-seated.
人は病の器
“Flesh is heir to many ills.”
病は口より入る
“Diseases enter at the mouth.”
気から病が出る
The mind rules the body―“Care preys upon life.”
病には勝てぬ
Man is a martyr to disease.
あの人は病の問屋だ
He is a storehouse of diseases.
病を押して出勤した
I went my office in spite of my illness.
病と称して出でず
He declined to see me on the plea of illness.
不治の病
an incurable disease
彼は不治の病にかかっている
He is an incurable.
癌は四百四病中の不治の病
Cancer is the most incurable of the ills that flesh is heir to.
ぶらぶら病
a lingering illness
恋の病
lovesickness
恋の病にかかる
to be sick for love
恋の病にかかった娘
a lovesick maiden
持った病
one's besetting sin
借金はあのひとの持った病だ
Running into debt is his besetting sin.
あの人は酒が持った病で止められない
He is an inveterate drunkard.
僕はタバコが病だ
I am an inveterate smoker.
嘘をつくのがあの男の病だ
He is an inveterate liar.
持った病は治らぬ
“The leopard can not change his spots.”

〈名〉A mad dog; a rabid dog

やまいぬ〔山犬〕

やまおろし〔山颪〕

content:

content:

〈名〉Speculation:(を略して)spec; a venture

content.content: 山かんをやる
to engage in speculation―make a venture
山かんで買ったのだ
