content:
やまぎ〔山気〕
〈名〉
1. (=投機心)a speculative spirit; enterprise

content.content: あれは山気の有る商人だ
He is an enterprising merchant.
山気を出す
to show enterprise

content: 2. (=衒気{げんき})pretension

content.content: 彼はちょいと山気のある家に住んでいる
He lives in a pretending house―a pretentious house.

やまきず〔山瑕〕
〈名〉A flaw in pottery (due to defective firing)

やまくじら〔山鯨〕
〈名〉Wild boar's meat

やまくずれ〔山崩れ〕
〈名〉A landslip

やまぐに〔山国〕
〈名〉A mountainous country

content:
やまごし〔山越し〕
〈名〉Crossing a mountain

content.content: 山越しした方がよほど近い
The mountain-pass is much nearer.

content:
やまざくら〔山桜〕
〈名〉The wild cherry; the mountain-cherry

content.content: 敷島の大和心を
The spirit of Yamato's isles
人問わば
If, chance, a stranger shall inquire,
朝日に匂う
Go show the morning sun that smiles
山桜花
Upon the mountain-cherry fair!

やまざと〔山里〕
〈名〉A mountain hamlet

やまざる〔山猿〕
〈名〉
1. A monkey
2. (=田舎者)a rustic; a boor

content:
やまし〔山師〕
〈名〉
1. (=鉱山師)a mine-broker
2. (=投機師、冒険家)a speculator; an adventurer
3. (=野師、詐欺師)a quack; a mountebank; a charlatan; an impostor

content.content: 世間には山師が多いから用心し給え
You must beware of impostors―guard against imposture.
山師会社
a bogus company
山師事業
a wild-cat scheme

content:
やまじ〔山路〕
〈名〉A mountain path

content.content: 山路をたどる
to trace a mountain-path

content:
やましい〔疚しい〕
〈形〉Conscious of having done wrong; uneasy in conscience

content.content: 内に省みてやましからず、心にやましいところが無い
I am not conscious of having done wrong―I am conscious of having done right―I have an easy conscience―I have a clear conscience.
彼は胸にやましいところがあるから赤面するのだ
He blushes, for he is conscious of having done wrong―for he has a guilty conscience.
心やましからざれば眠り安かなり
“A good conscience is a soft pillow.”

content:
やまだか〔山高〕
〈形〉High-crowned (hat)

content.content: 山高帽
a bowler―a billycock

やまたかぼう〔山高帽〕
〈名〉A high-crowned hat; a bowler; a billycock

content:
やまだし〔山出し〕
〈形〉Fresh from the mountains

content.content: 山出しの女中
a girl fresh from the country

やまつつじ〔山躑躅〕
〈名〉The rhododendron

やまつなみ〔山津浪〕
〈名〉A landslip

content:
やまと〔大和〕
〈固名〉Japan

content.content: 大和民族
the Japanese people―the sons of Yamato

やまとだましい〔大和魂〕
〈名〉The Japaneses spirit

やまどり〔山鳥〕
〈名〉The copper pheasant

content:
やまなか〔山中〕
〈形〉Among the mountains

content.content: 山中の一軒家
a solitary cottage among the mountains
山中の一小村
a hamlet nestling among the mountains

やまなし〔山梨〕
〈名〉The wild pear

content:
やまなす〔山なす〕
〈形〉Mountain-like

content.content: 山なす波が頭上にかぶさってきた
A mountain of a wave came falling over my head.

content:
やまなり〔山鳴り〕
〈名〉The rumbling of a mountain

content.content: 山鳴りがした
There were rumblings in the mountain.

やまねこ〔山猫〕
〈名〉The wild cat

やまのいも〔山の芋〕
〈名〉The yam

やまのかみ〔山の神〕
〈名〉
1. The god of mountains
2. (=女房をあざけって言う称)one's wife:(殊にやかましい女)a shrew; a termagant

content:
やまのて〔山の手〕
〈名〉(東京の山の手)the Hills:(横浜の山の手)the Bluff:(=に、=へ) up-town:(=の) up-town

content.content: 横浜の山の手には西洋館がある
There are foreigner's houses on the Bluff.
あの人は山の手にいる
He lives up-town.
山の手線
an up-town line

content:
やまのは〔山の端〕
〈名〉The contour of a mountain

content.content: 月が山の端から出る
The moon comes out from behind a mountain.
月が山の端に入る
The moon goes down behind a mountain.
山の端高く澄める月
the moon shining serene over the mountain

content:
やまのぼり〔山登り〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: とざん〔登山〕

やまばん〔山番〕
〈名〉A ranger; a forest-ranger

やまびらき〔山開き〕
〈名〉The opening of a mountain to climbers for the year

content:
やまぶき〔山吹〕
〈名〉The Japan globe-flower (Kerria japonica)

content.content: 山吹色
a bright yellow

content:
やまぶし〔山伏〕
〈名〉An itinerant monk

content.content: 義経は山伏に身をやつして東へ落ちた
Yoshitsune fled to the East under the guise of a monk.

やまぶどう〔山葡萄〕
〈名〉The wild grape

content:
やまふところ〔山懐〕
〈名〉A glen

content.content: 山懐の一小村
a hamlet nestling in a glen

やままゆ〔山繭〕
〈名〉The wild silkworm

やまみず〔山水〕
〈名〉A mountain-side fountain; water from it

やまめ〔山女〕
〈名〉A young salmon

やまもり〔山守〕
〈名〉A ranger; a forest-ranger

content:
やまもり〔山盛り〕
〈形〉Heaping full

content.content: 山盛りにする
to fill heaping full
籃に果物が山盛りに入っている
The basket is heaping full of fruit.
桝で山盛りに量る
to give a heaping measure
匙に山盛り
a heaping spoonful
飯を山盛りによそう
to fill the bowl heaping full of rice
山盛りに注げ
Fill the glass to the brim.

content:
やまやま〔山々〕
〈副〉Very much; ever so much

content.content: 行きたいのは山々だが先立つものは金だからね
Though I want to go ever so much, money is always the first consideration, you know.

やまゆり〔山百合〕
〈名〉The white lily

content:
やまわけ〔山分け〕
〈名〉An equal division; share and share alike :(=する) to divide equally; to share and share alike; to go halves; to go shares; to go snacks

content.content: 儲けは山分けにしよう
Let us go halves in the gain.

content:
やみ〔闇〕
〈名〉Darkness:(=の) dark

content.content: 真の闇だ
It is pitch-dark.
文目{あやめ}も分からぬ真の闇
It is too dark to see an inch before one.
闇に迷う
to wander in the darkness
恋の闇に迷う
to be blinded by love
闇にまぎれて逃げた
I fled under cover of darkness―under favour of darkness.
闇の夜
a dark night―a moonless night
闇の世
a dark age
一寸先は闇の世
The future is a sealed book―Life is not worth an hour's purchase.
飲めや歌えや一寸先は闇よ
“Eat and drink and make merry, for tomorrow you die.”
吉原が明るくなれば家は闇
When you are at home about town, it is dark at home.
闇から闇へ葬られる
A child dies in the womb―falls still-bron.
事件を闇から闇へ葬ってしまった
The matter was smothered up.

content:
やみあがり〔病み上り〕
〈名〉Convalescence:(=の) convalescent

content.content: 彼は病み上りで自宅療養中だ
He is convalescing at home.

content:
やみうち〔闇討〕
〈名〉Foul play; assassination:(=する) to assassinate; to play (one) foul; to deal foully with (one); to strike (one) in the dark

content.content: 闇討ちとは卑怯なり
This is foul play!
彼は闇討ちに逢った
He was foully dealt with―foully murdered.

やみかえし〔病み返し〕
〈名〉A relapse

やみかえす〔病み返す〕
〈自動〉To have a relapse; to relapse into illness

content:
やみくもに〔闇雲に〕
〈副〉At random; at hazard; at haphazard

content.content: 敵は暗闇にやみくもに発砲した
The enemy fired at random in the dark.
手当たり次第やみくもに本を読んだ
I read at hazard whatever I could lay my hands on.

content:
やみじ〔闇路〕
〈名〉A dark road

content.content: 闇路をたどる
to grope one's way in the dark
恋の闇路
the dark path of love
恋の闇路に踏み迷う
to lose oneself in the maze of love―“The course of true love never did run smooth.”

content:
やみつき〔病み付き〕
〈名〉Falling ill:(より)the beginning (of a bad habit)

content.content: 二人が花見で見初めたのが恋の病み付きとなった
Their first sight of each other at a cherry-party was the beginning of their love.
悪友に誘われて廓へ足を入れたのが病み付きで放蕩を始めた
He was tempted by some bad companions to set foot in evil quarters, and that was the beginning of his evil courses.
それがそもそもの病み付きだ
That was the beginning of the affair.

content:
やみつく〔病み付く〕
〈自動〉To fall ill:(より)to take to (a bad habit)

content.content: 無事に苦しんで酒とばくちに病み付いた
Having nothing to do, he took to gambling and drinking.
ばくちに病み付くと容易に治らない
One a gambler, always a gambler.

content:
やみやみ〔闇々〕
〈副〉
1. (=不意に)suddenly; without one's knowledge
2. (=むざむざ)easily

content.content: 敵のために闇々討たれた
He fell an easy victim to his enemy.

content:
やみよ〔闇夜〕
〈名〉A dark night; a moonless night

content.content: 闇夜に鉄砲
a random move
真の闇夜に
It is a pitch-dark night:
桜を削り
The cherry he doth pare,
赤き心を
And lays his red heart bare
墨で書く
In words of black and white.

content:
やむ〔止む〕
〈自動〉To stop; to cease; to end; to come to an end

content.content: この騒動はいつ止むだろうか
When will these troubles come to an end?
騒動が止んだ
The troubles are at an end―over.
雨が止んだ
It has stopped raining―The rain has held up―(米国にては)―The rain has let up.
雨がまだ止まない
It goes on raining.
この雨が止まなけりゃ洪水になる
If it goes on raining, there will be a flood.
風が止んだ
The wind has gone down―The wind has died away.
風がまだ止まない
It goes on blowing.
この風が止まなけりゃ舟が出せない
If it goes on blowing, we shall be unable to put off.
暴風雨が止んだ
The storm has subsided―The storm has abated.
砲火が止んだ
Firing has died down.
痛みがなかなか止まない
The pain will not go off.
戦争の為に商売がパッタリ止んだ
Owing to the war, business is at a standstill―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The war has brought the business to a standstill.
世の争いは止まぬ
Man will never cease from strife.
頭禿げても浮気は止まぬ
He is an old sinner.
僕は目的を遂げなければ止まない
I am determined to accomplish my purpose.
たとい死んでも止まない、死して後止む
I am determined to do or die.
巳んぬる哉
(孔子に言わせると)I give up!―(キリストに言わせれば)―Ye generation of vipers!
万事巳む
All is over―All is up.

content:
やむ〔病む〕
〈自動〉To be ill(は英); to be sick(は米); to ail

content.content: 彼は病むことここに三年
It is three years since he has been ill.
病める身には人の同情が嬉しい
Sympathy is welcome to the sick.

content: 〈他動〉To suffer from (an illness); to be afflicted with (a disease); to be troubled with (a disease); to be ill with (a fever)

content.content: 彼は肺病を病んでいる、痔を病んでいる、頭痛を病んでいる、熱病を病んでいる
He is suffering from consumption―afflicted with piles―troubled with a headache―ill with a fever.
彼は気を病む質だ
He will take things to heart.
気で気を病む
The heart preys on itself.

content:
やむなき〔已むなき〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: やむをえない〔已むを得ない〕

content:
やむなく〔已むなく〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: やむをえず〔已むを得ず〕

content:
やむをえざる〔不得止〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: やむをえない〔已むを得ない〕

content:
やむをえず〔已むを得ず〕
〈副〉Unavoidably; perforce; of necessity; under compulsion; (to be) under the necessity of (doing something); (to be) obliged, compelled, forced, constrained (to do something)

content.content: 彼はやむを得ず働くのだ
He works of necessity―He is under the necessity of working―obliged to work―compelled to work―forced to work―constrained to work.
ご用立てし金子、ご返済なくばやむえを得ず訴えます
If you will not pay me, I shall be obliged to bring an action against you.
やむを得ず訴えたのだ
I was obliged to bring an action against him―I found myself under the necessity of proceeding against him.
彼はあまり強情だからやむを得ず最後の手段をとったのだ
He was so obstinate that I was forced to go to extremes―(他動詞構文にすれば)―His obstinacy forced me to go to extremes―His obstinacy drove me to extreme measures.
そういうわけだからやむを得ずお断りするのです
Such being the case, I am under the necessity of refusing your request.
これは好んでしたのかやむを得ずしたのか
Did you do it of your own choice or of necessity?
好んで怠ける者はやむを得ず貧する
One who is idle by choice, will be poor by necessity.
やむを得ずば、やむなくば僕も働く
I will work, if necessary―if need be.

content:
やむをえない〔已むを得ない〕
〈形〉Necessary; inevitable; unavoidable; not to be avoided; not to be helped; beyond one's control

content.content: 不得止事情{やむをえざるじじょう}
unavoidable circumstances―circumstances beyond one's control
不得止事故有之欠席仕候
Unavoidable circumstances oblige me to absent myself―I am obliged by circumstances beyond my control to absent myself―I am obliged to absent myself.
不得止事{やむをえざること}とは言いながら遺憾なわけです
It is not the less to be regretted because it is not be avoided.
多少の誤りはやむを得ない
Some mistakes are not to be avoided―not to be helped.
これはやむを得ない(しかたがない)
It can not be helped―There is no help for it.
これは人生やむを得ないことだ
This is the inevitable lot of humanity.

content:
やめ〔止め〕
〈名〉
1. (=中止)stop; cessation; discontinuance; end:(=る) to stop (doing something); to cease (doing something―from some action); to quit (doing something); to leave off, break off (doing something); to discontinue (a study); to desist (from the attempt); to end (anything); to put an end to (anything)

content.content: 止めろ
Stop!―Have done!
冗談止めろ
Stop joking!―No more of your jokes!
撃ち方止め
Stop firing!
漕ぎ方止め
Stop rowing!―Easy all!
京都行きは止めになった
My visit to Kyoto is at an end―over.
秀吉が死んで朝鮮征伐は止めになった
The death of Hideyoshi brought the Korean invasion to an end.
もう仕事を止める時間だ
It is time to leave off work―knock off work.
僕が行くと皆話しを止める
They leave off talking at my approach.
この新聞は面白くないから止めよう
I'll stop taking this paper, for it does not read well.
彼は英語の先生を止めた
He has quitted teaching English.
暫くドイツ語を止めている
I have discontinued the study of German for a time.
人間は戦争を止めぬ
Man will never cease from strife.
彼は演説の真中で急に止めた
He broke off in the midst of his speech.
この取引きは止めだ
I will break off the bargain―declare off the bargain.
君が入らなければ僕もお止めだ
If you will not join, I will beg off―cry off.
銀行と取引を止める
to close an account with a bank
人と交際を止める
to drop an acquaintance
習慣を止める
to lay aside a habit
彼は誰が来ても読書を止めぬ
Whoever may come, he goes on reading.
僕はまだ同窓と文通を止めぬ
I still keep up correspondence with my college friends.
先方が謝罪しなければこのけんかは止められぬ
If the other party will not apologize, the affair must go up―proceed.
もう馬車は止めだ
I will put down my carriage―The carriage must go.

content: 2. (=断念)abandonment:(=る) to abandon; to give up

content.content: 酒を止める、タバコを止める
to give up drinking―give up smoking
酒を止めた
I have given up drinking―sworn off drinking―drunk my last cup.
タバコを止めた
I have given up smoking―smoked my last pipe―laid aside my pipe.
彼は医者の止めるのも聴かずに酒を止めぬ
He keeps on drinking in defiance of his doctor's warning.
彼は酒が好きで止められない
He has an unconquerable love for drink―He is an inveterate drunkard.
僕はどうしてもタバコが止められぬ
Nothing can make me give up smoking―I am an inveterate smoker.
この目が治らなけりゃ学問を止めなければならぬ
If my eyes do not get well, I shall have to give up my studies.
僕は商売を止めなけりゃよかった
I wish I had not given up my business.
僕は金が出ないから洋行を止めた
I have given up the idea of going abroad, for I can not find the means.
計画は止めになった
The project has been abandoned.
誰がなんと言ってもこのことばかりは止められぬ
Nobody can deter me from the step.

content: 3. (=辞職、廃業)resignation; retirement:(=る) to resign (one's office); to retire from (business); to leave; to quit

content.content: 役を止める
to resign one's office―leave office
商売を止める
to retire from business―give up one's business
学校を止める
to leave school
あの時学校を中途で止めなけりゃよかった
I wish I had not left school half way.
先生を止めて実業界に入る者がある
Some men quit teaching and go into business.
要求を容れなけりゃ僕は止める
If they will not comply with my demands, I will leave.
こう不意に止めるのはお気の毒ですが
I am sorry to leave you at such short notice.
時に井上君はなぜ止めたのか
By the bye, why has Mr. Inoue left?

content: 4. (=廃止)abolition:(=る) to abolish; to do away with (anything)

content.content: 礼儀を止めて無礼講にしようじゃないか
Let us do away with ceremony!―Let all ceremony be down away with!

content:
やめさせる〔止めさせる〕
〈他動〉To stop; to put a stop to, put an end to, put a period to (anything); to dissuade (one from doing anything); to dismiss (one from office)

content.content: あの騒ぎを止めさせてくれ
Stop that noise!
けんかを止めさせよう
I will put and end to the quarrel.
二人に道理を説いて争いを止めさせた
I reasoned them out of the dispute.
彼は役をやめさせられた
He has been dismissed from office.
彼にあの女を貰うのを止めさせた
I have dissuaded him from marrying the girl.
子どもに学校を止めさせなければなりません
I must take my boy away from school.

やもう〔夜盲〕
〈名〉Night-blindness; nyctalopia:(=の) night-blind

やもめ〔寡婦〕
〈名〉A widow; a relict

content:
やや〔稍〕
〈副〉
1. (=少し)Somewhat; something; a little; rather

content.content: こちらはやや勝{まさ}っている
This is somewhat better―something better―a little better―than the other.
病人はやや快方に赴いた
The invalid is a little better―rather better.
彼の英語はややなっている
His English is something like.

content: 2. (=暫し)a little while

content.content: ややあって彼は帰って来た
He came back after a while.

content:
ややこしい
〈形〉Intricate; complicated; multum-in-parvo

content.content: ややこしい家だ
The house is cut up into small rooms.
船の中はややこしいものだ
A ship contains much in small compass.

content:
ややひさしく〔稍久しく〕
〈副〉For a good while

content.content: 待つことやや久しくして彼は帰って来た
I had waited a good while, when he came back.

content:
ややもすれば〔動もすれば〕
〈副〉(To be) apt, liable, prone (to do something)

content.content: 世人はややもすればこの誤りに陥る
People are apt to fall into this error.
日本の学生はややもすれば勉強し過ぎる
Japanese students are apt to overwork themselves.
人はややもすれば謝る
Man is liable to error.

やゆ〔揶揄〕
〈名〉Banter; chaff; raillery:(=する) to banter, chaff, rally, make fun of, make sport of, poke fun at (one)

やよい〔弥生〕
〈名〉The third month (of the Lunar Calendar)

content:
やら
〈副〉
1. (=など)and so forth; and so on; and the like; and all that; and what not:(原因を数えれば)what with..., what with...:(方法を数えれば)what by..., what by...

content.content: 紅やら白粉やら(なにやらかにやら)
rough, powder, and what not
接吻するやら抱きつくやら
There was kissing, hugging, and all that.
泣くやら笑うやら
They were crying, laughing, and what not.
打つやら蹴るやら
They beat him, kicked him, and all that.
授業やら著述やらで手いっぱいだ
What with teaching, what with writing,―Between teaching and writing,―my hands are full.
嬉しいやら悲しいやらで胸がいっぱいだ
What with joy, what with sorrow,―Between joy and sorrow,―her heart was full.
強請{ゆすり}やら騙{かた}りやらでひとかどの身代をこしらえた
What by extortion, what by fraud,―Between blackmail and imposture,―he made quite a fortune.
嚇{おど}すやら賺{すか}すやらでとうとう納得さした
What by threats, what by entreaties,―Between threats and entreaties,―they finally made her comply.

content: 2. (=か否や)if; whether (or not)

content.content: 彼は来るものやら来ないものやらわからない
I can't say whether he will come or not.
本当なものやら嘘なものやらわからない
I don't know whether it is true or false.
何が何やらサッパリわからぬ
I can make nothing of it―I don't know what to make of it―I can't make head or tail of it.

content: 3. (=かしら)I wonder if, whether, who, what, when, where, how (... can...)

content.content: 彼はどうなったことやら
I wonder what can have become of him―What can have become of him?
今頃はどこにどうしていやしゃんすやら
I wonder where he can now be.
末はどうなることやら
I wonder how it will end.
いつ果てることやら
I wonder when it will end.
とんぼ釣り
Thou catcher of the dragon-fly!
今日はどこまで行ったやら
How far canst thou have gone to day?

content: 4. (=人言う)people say; they say

content.content: 人死せんとするやその言うこと好しとやら
They say that we should listen to the words of a dying man.
彼は豪州とやらへ行きました
He has gone to a country called Australia.
高杉とやらいうお方がお留守中に見えました
A gentleman named Takasugi―A Mr. Takasugi―called in your absence.
これ朝顔とやら
Here, (woman they call) Asagao!

content: 〈接尾詞〉(=か)some

content.content: 何やら
something
誰やら
some one―somebody
どこやら
somewhere
どうやら
somehow
誰やらの本にそう書いてある
Somebody's work says so.
犬が何やら赤いものをくわえて来た
The dog has come with something red in his mouth.
何やら字が書いてある
There are some characters on it.
彼はどこやらへ行ってしまった
He has gone somewhere―He has gone God knows where.
彼は何やらしきりに研究している
He is studying something―He is studying I don't know what.
彼はどこやら愛嬌がある
There is a certain charm about him.
二人はどこやら似ている
There is a certain resemblance between the two.
どうやら本当らしい
Somehow it seems to be true.
どうやら僕にもできそうだ
I feel within me that I can do it.
いつの間にやら二人は夫婦になっていた
They were man and wife before we knew where we were.

content:
やらい〔夜来〕
〈副〉Since last night; during the night

content.content: 夜来の雨が朝になって晴れた
It rained during the night, but cleared up in the morning.

content:
やらい〔矢来〕
〈名〉A palisade; a stockade

content.content: 矢来をめぐらす
to enclose a space with a palisade―palisade a space
竹矢来
a bamboo palisade

content:
やらかす〔遣らかす〕
〈他動〉To do (something); to commit (a blunder, etc.)

content.content: とんでもない失錯をやらかした
I have committed an egregious blunder.
早速やらかした
I proceeded to business at once.
彼は鰻飯を二三杯やらかして平気でいる
He makes nothing of finishing two or three bowls of eel and rice.

content:
やられる〔遣られる〕
〈被動〉To be done something to ［注意］一定の訳語無し。

content.content: (敵弾を受けて)とうとうやられたわい
“They have done for me at last.”
やられた
I am done for.
まんまとやられた(だまされた)
I was nicely taken in―done brown.
電車で時計をやられた(取られた)
I had my watch stolen when riding in a car.
彼は株でひどくやられた
He was hard hit in speculation.
流感にやられた
I am attacked with influenza.
彼は大地震でひどくやられた(損害を蒙った)
He suffered a heavy damage at the Great Earthquake.
彼は奉天戦で足をやられた(負傷した)
He was wounded in the leg at the battle of Mukden.

content:
やり〔槍〕
〈名〉A spear:(騎兵の槍)a lance:(海兵の槍)a pike

content.content: 槍で突く
to thrust at one with a spear―pierce one with a spear―spear one
槍傷
a spear-thrust
槍を扱{しご}く
to pass a spear through the hand (several times, preparatory to making a thrust)
槍ひと筋の主
a samurai
槍ひと筋の家
a samurai family
槍は錆びても名は錆びぬ
My sword may rust, but I keep my honour bright.
槍が降っても行く
I will go even if it should rain pitchforks.
槍の穂
a spear-head
槍の柄
the shaft (of a spear)
槍先の功名
a fair spoil of war―a lawful prize of war
槍持ち
a spear-bearer

content:
やりかけ〔遣り掛け〕
〈形〉Half-done:(=る) to begin doing (anything); to set to work; to set about (one's task)

content.content: やりかけの仕事がある
I have some work in hand.
今やりかけたばかりだ
I have only just set to work.
あの人はいつもやりかけだ(仕上げるということが無い)
He leaves everything half-done.

content:
やりかた〔遣り方〕
〈名〉How to go about (anything); the way to do (anything); the method of procedure; the way of proceeding; course of conduct; management

content.content: 君のやり方はどうか
How do you go about it?―How do you proceed?―What is your method of procedure?―What is your way of proceeding?
やり方が悪いからうまくいかないのだ
You do not succeed, for you go about it in the wrong way―proceed in the wrong way.
僕のやり方はこうだ
This is how I go about it―I proceed in this way.
君のやり方は皆自己流だ
You do everything in your own way.
やり方を教えてくれ給え
Show me how to do it.
やり方が上手だと月百円で暮らせる
By skilful management, you might get along on 100 yen a month.
君はやり方が下手だから駄目だ
You spoil everything by ill management.
あの人のやり方は引っ込み思案だ
His methods are conservative.

content:
やりきれない〔遣り切れない〕
〈自動〉Can not get along; can't make both ends meet; can't stand it; that's too bad

content.content: 月百円じゃやりきれない
I can not get along on 100 yen a month.
どんなにつましくしてもやりきれない
The utmost frugality will not enable me to make both ends meet.
こう暑くちゃやりきれない
I can't stand the heat.
苦しくてやりきれない
I can't stand the strain―The strain is intolerable.
こう不景気じゃやりきれない
The times are too bad.
玄米の粥だって、やりきれない
Gruel of uncleaned rice? That's too bad.
(人が言ったうまいしゃれに対して)どうもやりきれませんね
Well, that's a good one.

content:
やりくち〔遣り口〕
〈名〉One's way of proceeding; one's course of proceeding; one's method of procedure

content.content: あれがあの男のいつものやり口だ
This is his usual course of proceeding.
ずいぶん悪辣なやり口で
It is an unscrupulous way of proceeding.
なかなか振るったやり口だ
His procedure is energetic.
やり口で人間がわかる
The procedure shows the man.
(武士は武士、町人は町人)人は皆それぞれやり口がある
Every man acts after his kind.

content:
やりくり〔遣り繰り〕
〈名〉
1. Contrivance; management; shifts; makeshifts; shifting and contriving; cutting and contriving:(=する) to contrive; to manage; to shift; to makeshift; to shift and contrive; to cut and contrive

content.content: あの女はやりくりが上手だ
She contrives well―She is a good contriver―She is good at cutting and contriving.
都々逸は下手でもやりくりは上手
I am a poor singer, but a good contriver.
僕はやりくりが下手だ
I am ill at contriving―a poor contriver.
どうかやりくりしよう
I will contrive as I can―shift as I can―make shift as I can.
あの家はやりくり身上だ
Theirs is a makeshift housekeeping.
あの会社はやりくりで立っている
The company exists by makeshifts.
あの人は定職が無いからやりくりで暮らしている
He has no regular occupation, and lives by makeshifts―lives by his wits.
うまくやりくりすると月百円で暮らしていける
By good management, one might get along on 100 yen a month.
財政、金融のやりくり
kite-flying
やりくり師
a kite-flier
大蔵大臣はやりくりがうまい
The Minister of Finance is a juggler―a financial juggler.
その頃は政府の財政にやりくりがあった
The then government resorted to financial juggling.

content:
やりくりさんだん〔遣繰算段〕
〈名〉Shifting and contriving; cutting and contriving:(=する) to shift and contrive; to cut and contrive

content.content: 金融財政のやりくり算段
kite-flying―financial juggling

content:
やりくる〔遣り繰る〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: やりくり〔遣り繰り〕

content:
やりこなす〔遣りこなす〕
〈他動〉To manage (a difficult task)

content.content: 君にこの仕事がやりこなせるか
Do you think you can manage the task?
役者が難役をやりこなす
An actor humours a difficult part.

content:
やりこめる〔遣り込める〕
〈他動〉To corner (one); to drive (one) into a corner

content.content: やり込められてとうとう降参した
Driven into a corner, he finally acknowledged his defeat.
その質問でやり込めてやった
The question cornered him.

やりさきのこうみょう

やりさきのこうみょう〔槍先の功名〕
〈名〉A fair spoil of war; a lawful prize of war

content:
やりすぎる〔遣り過ぎる〕
〈自他動〉To overdo (anything); to overact one's part

content.content: 彼は才に任してやり過ぎるから失敗するのだ
His talents make him overact his part, and that is the cause of his failure.
彼はちとやり過ぎるから同僚と折り合わないのだ
He is too smart by half, and that's why he can't get on with his colleagues.

content:
やりそこない〔遣り損い〕
〈名〉A failure; a miscarriage; a miss

content.content: 今度の計画はやり損いだ
The new scheme is a failure―The new scheme has miscarried.
こんな計画はやり損いに終る
Such schemes end in failure.
やり損いの無いように万全の策をとる
We must adopt a safe plan to preclude the possibility of failure―to obviate the possibility of failure.

content:
やりそこなう〔遣り損う〕
〈自動〉To fail; to miscarry; to miss one's aim; to miss one's tip; to miss the mark; to spoil the game; to come to grief

content.content: やり損う気遣いは無い
There is no fear of failure.
もし万一やり損ったらまたやる
If, by any chance, I should fail, I would try again―I will make another effort in the event of failure.
やり損うと悪いからなるべく気を付けて
You must use the utmost care, lest you should fail―for fear you should fail―in case you should fail.
用心しないとやり損うぞ
Take care, or you will spoil the game―come to grief.
やり損った
I have done it.
またやり損った
Just my luck!

やりだし〔遣り出し〕
〈名〉A bowsprit

content:
やりだま〔槍玉〕
〈名〉A mark for a spear

content.content: 槍玉に上げる
to make an example of one
犯人はつかまえ次第槍玉に上げる
I will make an example of the first offender I catch.
彼は槍玉に上げられて放逐された
He was made an example of and dismissed.

content:
やりつくす〔遣り尽す〕
〈自動〉To do all one can; to try everything; to leave nothing undone

content.content: 人がやり尽した後だから名案が出ない
I can think of no good plan, for they have left nothing undone.

やりつける〔遣り付ける〕
〈他動〉To be accustomed to doing (something); to be used to doing (something); to be wont to do (something)

content:
やりっぱなし〔遣り放し〕
〈形〉Negligent; neglectful; careless; off-hand

content.content: 彼は仕事もやりっぱなしだ
He is neglectful of everything―negligent of everything.
君はやりっぱなしで困る
You are too careless.
やりっぱなしにする
to be careless―let things take care of themselves―leave anything to chance
彼は仕事をやりっぱなしにしない
He does his work carefully.

content:
やりて〔遣り手〕
〈名〉
1. (=敏腕家)an able man; a man of ability

content.content: あれはなかなかのやり手だ
He is a man of great ability.

content: 2. (=妓楼の鴇母{やりてばば})the matron (of a brothel)

やりとおす〔遣り通す〕
〈他動〉To go through with (anything); to put (a matter) through; to carry (a matter) through

content.content: この事業はやり通す決心だ
I am determined to go through with the undertaking.
男の意地としてやり通さなければならぬ
My sense of honour dictates that I should put it through.

content:
やりとり〔遣り取り〕
〈名〉Give-and-take; exchange:(=する) to give and take; to exchange

content.content: 盃のやり取りは日本だけか
Is Japan the only country where people exchange cups in drinking?
手紙のやり取り
correspondence
手紙のやり取りをする
to correspond with one
命のやり取りをする
to engage in mortal combat
天下やり取りのばくち
to play for Empire

content:
やりなおし〔遣り直し〕
〈名〉Doing over again

content.content: さあやり直しだ
Now it must be done over again.

content:
やりなおす〔遣り直す〕
〈他動〉To do (anything) over again

content.content: うまくいかなかったら幾度でもやり直す
If it does not go well, it must be done over and over again.

content:
やりにくい〔遣りにくい〕
〈形〉Awkward (task); delicate (position); ticklish (mission, etc.)

content.content: やりにくい仕事だ
It is an awkward task―an ugly job.
彼はやりにくい立場だ
He is in a delicate position―in an awkward situation.
君にそうされると僕の立場がやりにくくなる
You place me in a delicate position.
僕はやりにくい使命を引き受けてしまった
I have undertaken a delicate mission―a ticklish mission.

content:
やりぬく〔遣り抜く〕
〈自他動〉To do (anything) to the bitter end; to fight it out

content.content: 手を出したからはどこまでもやり抜く決心だ
Now that I have put my hand to the plough, I am determined to fight it out.

content:
やりば〔遣り場〕
〈名〉Disposal

content.content: 品物のやり場が無い
How shall I dispose of the goods?
身体のやり場に困っている
I do not know what to do with myself.

やりはご〔遣り羽子〕
〈名〉(The game of) battledore and shuttlecock

やりぶすま〔槍襖〕
〈名〉A fence of spears

content:
やりみず〔遣り水〕
〈名〉A garden stream

content.content: 庭へ遣り水を引く
to draw a stream through a garden

やりもち〔槍持ち〕
〈名〉A spear-bearer

content:
ヤール
〈名〉A yard

content.content: 西洋織物はヤールいくらで売買する
Foreign cloths are sold by the yard.
羅紗が四ヤールあれば洋服ができる
Four yards of cloth is enough for a suit.

content:
やる〔遣る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=与える)to give (one something)

content.content: どうせやるなら早くやれ
If you do give at all, give quickly.
返礼に何をやろうか
What shall I give him in return for his present?
骨折り賃をいくらやろうか
What shall I pay him for his trouble?
今度の男はいくらおやりになりますか
What will you give your new man?―What shall your new man have?
月五十円やろう
I will give him―He shall have―fifty yen a month.
月五十円やろうと言った
I offered him fifty yen a month.
欲しけりゃやる
If you want it, you shall have it―You are welcome to it.
女中に祝儀をやる
to tip the maid
少ないがこれをお前にやる
Here is something for you.
この銭は誰にやるのですか
Whom is the money for?
車屋にやるのだ
It is for the jinrikishaman.
あの男には暇をやりました
I have dismissed the man from my service.
鶏に何をおやりになりますか
What do you feed your hens on?
馬には麦と豆をやります
I feed my horse on corn and beans.

content: 2. (=送る)to send

content.content: 使いをやる
to send (a messenger)
手紙をやる
to write (a letter) to one
使いを止して手紙をやろう
I will write instead of sending.
医者を呼びにやれ
Send for the doctor!
小僧をお使いにやりました
I have sent the boy on an errand.
お父様、いつから学校へ遣って下さいますか
Father, when will you send me to school?―when shall I go to school?
来春からやる
I will send you to school―You shall go to school―next spring.

content: 3. (=する)to do (anything)

content.content: あの人は何でもやる
He can do anything―He can turn his hand to anything―He is a versatile man.
彼のやりそうなことだ
It is just like him to do so―The action is characteristic of the man.
彼は狂言をやっているのだ
He is acting a part.
(人の失錯したのを見て)やったな
He has done it!
よしやれ
Go ahead!
ドシドシやれ
Fire away!
急いでやってくれ
Please make haste with the work!
ゆっくりやってもよい
You may do it at your leisure―You may take your own time for doing it.
こうやってやれ
Do it this way!
今度は誰がやる番か
Whose turn is it?
今度は僕のやる番だ
It is my turn next.
やるところまでやらなければならん
We must fight it out―fight to a finish.
戦争は善い事ではないがやるくらいならどこまでもやれ
War is an evil. But if you do fight, fight it out.
やるようにしてやればやれる
You may do it if you go about it in the right way.
貴様は味をやりおるな
You are playing your little game.
奴なかなか味をやる
He carries it off very well.
番狂わせをやる
to spring a surprise
奴うまくやってい上がる
The lucky beggar!
やってみる
to try
一つやってみよう
I will have a try at it.
僕にできるかどうかやってみよう
I will see if I can.
やっても駄目だ(から止せ)
It is no use trying.
やってしまう
to finish―get through with―anything
この仕事を今晩中にやってしまわなければならぬ
I must get my work finished in the course of the evening.
彼は立派にやってのけた
He has acquitted himself to his credit.
彼にやらしてみよう
I will try him at it.

content: 4. (=遊戯をやる)to play (a game―at a game)

content.content: 君は玉突きをやるか
Do you play billiards?
やるにはやるけれども下手だ
I am a poor player.
近頃やらないから下手になっている
I am rather out of practice.
一番やろうか
Will you have a game?
君のやる番だ
It is your turn (to play).

content: 5. (=演ずる、演奏する)to play (a part―the piano―on the piano); to perform (a part―on the piano)

content.content: 君はピアノをやるか
Do you play the piano?
やるはやるけれども下手だ
I am a poor player―a poor performer―(on the piano).
誰が弁慶をやったか
Who played (the part of) Benkei?
あの役者は弁慶をやらせるとうまいもんだ
He performs the part of Benkei well―He plays Benkei to admiration.

content: 6. (=飲食する)to eat; to drink; to take; to have

content.content: 一杯やろうじゃないか
Let us have a drink!
一服おやりなさい
Won't you have a smoke?

content: 7. (=学ぶ)to study; to learn

content.content: 君はドイツ語をやったか
Have you studied German?
今やっている
I am studying it―leaning it.
君は英語を何年やっているか
How long have you been studying English?
この四月で五年やる
I shall have been studying it for five years by April next.
僕はこれから課業をやらんならん
I must now learn my lesson―go at my lesson.

content: 8. (=話す、できる)to speak; to know

content.content: 彼は英語仏語独語をやる
He knows English, French and German.
あの西洋人は五六カ国の語をやる
He speaks several languages.
日本にロシア語をやる人は少ない
Few Japanese speak Russian.

content: 9. (=経営する)to conduct; to keep; to run; to work

content.content: 彼は学校をやっている
He keeps a school―runs a school.
あのホテルは誰がやっているか
Who runs that hotel?
僕の友人が新聞をやっている
A friend of mine conducts a journal―runs a newspaper.
この雑誌は誰がやっているか
Who runs this magazine?
あの人は鉱山をやって金を儲けたのだ
He made his fortune by working a mine.
彼の弟は北海道で農園をやっている
His brother works a farm in Hokkaido.
舟をやる
to row a boat―sail a boat
港までやってくれ
Row me to the port.
馬を遣る
to despatch a horse
根岸まで馬をやっておくれ
Carry me as far as the foot of the mountain.

content: 12. (=人に何をしてやる)(to do anything) for one

content.content: 今開けてやる
I will open the door for you.
彼は読めないから手紙を読んでやった
As he could not read, I read the letter for him.
彼女は書くことができないから僕が手紙を書いてやる
As she can not write, I write her letters for her.［注意］この“for”を略して代名詞を間接目的とする動詞あり。
水を一杯持って来てやれ
Get him a glass of water.
お前に洋服を新調してやろう
I will make you a new suit of clothes.
帽子も買ってやる
I will buy you a hat.
靴もこしらえてやる
I will make you a pair of shoes.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 犬が入りたいのだから入れてやれ
The dog wants to come in―let him in!
猫が出たいのだから出してやれ
The cat wants to go out―let her out!
金が無けりゃ貸してやれ
If he has no money, lend him some!
子どもを見てやれ
Look after the child!―Take care of the child!

content:
やるかたなし〔遣る方無し〕
〈自動〉Can not contain (some emotion)

content.content: 無念やる方無し
I am filled with resentment.

content:
やるせない〔遣る瀬無い〕
〈形〉Inconsolable; cheerless; miserable

content.content: 病人はやるせない月日を送っている
The invalid drags out a miserable existence.

content:
ヤレ
〈間投詞〉Oh!

content:

〈自動〉To soften; to moderate; to relax; to relent; to calm; to cool; to be allayed; to be alleviated; to be assuaged; to be mitigated; to be palliated; to be pacified; to be appeased

content:
ゆうき〔勇気〕
〈名〉Courage; bravery; boldness; valour; daring; pluck; heart

content.content: 彼は勇気が有る
He is courageous―brave―bold―daring―plucky.
勇気が無い
He is timid―timorous―lily-livered―a coward.
彼は義を見てこれを為すの勇気が有る
He has the courage to do what is right in his sight―He dares to do right.
彼は己が意見を敢行するの勇気が有る
He has the courage of his opinions.
彼らはものを言う勇気は無い
They have not the courage to speak―They dare not speak.
彼は君に向かってそう言う勇気は有るまい
He dare not say so to your face.
もう疲れてその山を越す勇気は無かった
I was too tired to cross the mountain.
眠くて質問する勇気も無かった
I was too sleepy to be asking questions.
勇気を出す、勇気を揮るう
to muster up one's courage―summon up one's courage―screw up one's courage―pluck up one's heart
渾身の勇気を揮るった
I mustered up all my courage.
勇気を付ける
to encourage one―(無意志なら)―embolden one.
彼の言葉を聞いて勇気が付いた
I was encouraged by his words―I took heart at his words.
(知らせを聞いて)勇気百倍す
The news inspired us with fresh courage.
勇気を失う
to lose courage―lose heart―My heart fails me
勇気を失うな
Keep a good heart!―Be of good heart!
勇気をそぐ、勇気をくじく
to discourage one―dishearten one
彼は勇気絶倫だ
He is a man of matchless courage.
勇気当たるべからず
His valour is resistless―He is as bold as a lion.
勇気勃々{ぼつぼつ}
to be valiant-looking―grim-looking
勇気勃々たる軍艦
a valiant warship―a grim warship
勇気凛々{りんりん}としている
He is high-spirited―high-mettled―dashing.
勇気凛々たる少壮士官だ
He is a dashing young officer.
お声が勇気凛々としていらっしゃるからきっとあなただと思いましたわ
I knew by your ringing voice that it was you.
真性の勇気
genuine courage―moral courage
危険を恐れぬ勇気
personal courage
酒の勇気
Dutch courage―pot-valour.
彼らは酒で勇気を付けておった
They were potvaliant.

He plunged into the pleasures of the town.
その時は彼は新橋で遊興中であった
Then he was on the spree in a fashionable quarter.

content:

〈名〉
1. (=厚遇)a warm reception; a cordial reception; a hearty welcome; hospitality; entertainment; f?te:(=する) to welcome, entertain, f?te, make much of, make a lion of, lionize (a guest)

content.content: 彼は到る所で優遇された
He was welcomed―f?ted―accorded a cordial reception―made much of―made a lion of―lionized―received with distinction―wherever he went.
彼は客人を優遇する
He is hospitable to his guests―He keeps open house.

content: 2. (=優待)handsome treatment:(=する) to treat (one) handsomely; to act handsomely towards (one); to do the handsome thing by (one)

content.content: あの学校では教員を優遇する
The teachers of that school are handsomely treated―(露骨に言えば)―well paid.
中等教員優遇案
a proposal to improve the treatment of middle-school teachers―(露骨に言えば)―a proposal to increase the pay of middle-school teachers.

autumn evening
心無き身にも
Even to the ascetic pale
哀れは知られけり
It is a pensive sight,
鴫立つ沢の
The autumn's even of the dale
秋の夕暮
Whence curlews take their flight!

content.content: 契約は一年間有効
The contract holds good for a year.
有効な契約
a valid contract
切符は三日間有効

有効な処置

有効な方法
an effectual method
有効な担保

有効数字
a significant figure
有効期間

切符の有効期間は一週間

砲撃が有効であった

有効距離

有効になる
(法律なら)A law comes into effect―comes into force―becomes effective―becomes operative―(契約などなら)―A contract becomes valid―takes effect.
(法律などを)有効にする
to give effect to a law
有効な法律

content:
ゆうずう〔融通〕
〈名〉
1. (=流通)circulation:(=する) to circulate

content.content: 金は天下の融通物
Money is a thing that comes and goes.
金融機関(通貨)
a circulating medium

content: 2. (=金銭の貸借)accommodation:(=する) to accommodate (one with a loan)

content.content: 金を融通する
to accommodate one with a loan
五千円ばかり融通して下さるまいか
Could you accommodate me with 5,000 yen?
融通力
credit
君は融通が利くか
Have you good credit?―Does your credit stand well?
融通が利かない
I have no credit.
融通が利かなくなった
My credit is cracked―I have a cracked credit.
彼はなかなか融通が利く
His credit stands high.
彼は一万円の融通が利く
His credit is good for 10,000 yen.
あの人が署名さえすればいくらでも融通が利く
His name is good for anything he chooses to put his hand to.
彼は金も無く融通も利かず進退谷まっている
He is in a fix without money or credit.
融通手形

content: 3. (=変通の才)adaptability; versatility; flexibility; elasticity

content.content: 融通を利かす
to adapt oneself to new conditions―accommodate oneself to circumstances
融通が利く
to be adaptable―versatile―flexible―elastic
融通が利かない
to be unadaptable―inflexible―rigid
日本人は融通が利く
The Japanese can adapt themselves to altered conditions―The Japanese are an adaptable people.
あれは融通の利く男だ
He is a versatile man―He can turn his hand to anything―He is a flexible character―He knows how to accommodate himself to circumstances.
あれは頑固で融通の利かない男だ
He is a rigid moralist.
英語は融通の利く言葉だ
English is a flexible language―an elastic language.

to ask for time

瞬時も猶予すべからず

content:

content.content: 冬は雪が降る

雪が大分積もった

雪が五寸積もった

頭に積もる七十路の雪

越後は雪が多い

雪溶けする

山の雪が消える
Snow disappears from the mountains.
雪の消える頃に鳴く鳥だ

雪を分けて行軍する

雪は豊年の兆
Snow is the sign of a good harvest.
雪のように白い

土付かずの雪のよう

雪の肌
a snow-white skin
雪を欺く肌

我が物と思えば軽し笠の雪
“A voluntary burden is no burden.”
雪の朝{あした}は裸虫の洗濯

content.content: そのやり方は行き過ぎている
You are going too far―carrying the matter too far―carrying the matter to excess―going beyond all bounds.
それは行き過ぎた考えだ

content: 2. (=齟齬{そご})something wrong

content.content: もう今頃は行き着いたろう
He must have reached his destination―got to his journey's end―by this.
もう京都へ行き着いたろう

今立ったら何時に行き着きますか
If I start now, what time shall I arrive?―What time shall I get there?
我が家へ行き着く
to get home

〈名〉A standstill; a dead-lock; an impasse

As matters now stand, they are doomed to a standstill.

content:
ゆきづまる〔行き詰まる〕
〈自他動〉To come to a standstill; to come to a dead-lock; to be reduced to extremity; to be driven to the last extremity; to be driven to one's wits' end; to be driven into a corner; to be cornered; to come into a blind alley; to come into an impasse; to be at a loss (for an answer); to be hard up (for money); to stick (fast); to break down

content.content: 談判が行き詰まった
The negotiations have come to a standstill―come to a dead-lock―The negotiations are at a standstill―at a dead-lock.
もう行き詰まってどうすることもできない(絶体絶命)
I am reduced to the last extremity―driven to my wits' end―in an impasse―in a blind alley.
グッと返答に行き詰まった
I was at a loss for an answer.
彼はとうとう議論に行き詰まった
He was at last driven into a corner―cornered.
議論に行き詰まって無茶なことを言い出した
Driven into a corner, he came roundly up to the statement that two and two may not always make four.
そこまでどうやら言ったがそこでグッと行き詰まった
I expressed myself somehow so far, and there stuck.
僕は金に行き詰まっている
I am hard up.
彼は演説の最中に行き詰まった
He broke down in the midst of his speech.

content:

〈自動〉To be careful; to be attentive; to be prudent; to be thorough; to be complete; to be perfect

content.content: 彼は年の若さにしては行き届いている
He is prudent, considering his youth.
あの人は隅から隅まで行き届いている
He is attentive to the minutest details―scrupulously careful―thorough-going.
彼女はかゆいところへ手の届くように行き届いて世話をする
She anticipates your very wishes.
忙しくてそこまでは行き届かぬ
We are too busy to attend to such details.
家は手入れが行き届いている、手入れが行き届かぬ
The house is in good repair―out of repair.
庭は掃除が行き届いている、掃除が行き届かぬ
The garden is well kept―ill kept.
家の掃除が隅から隅まで行き届いている
The house is kept with the utmost cleanliness.
あの旅館は客扱いが行き届いている
The guest is well served at the hotel―They are very attentive to the guest at the hotel.
日本は警察が行き届いている
Japan has a perfect police-system―Japan is under perfect police control.
支那は警察が行き届かぬ
The police-system is imperfect in China―China is under imperfect police control.
寄宿舎は衛生設備が行き届いている
The dormitory has complete sanitary arrangements.
衛生設備が行き届かない
The sanitary arrangements are incomplete.
子どもの世話が行き届いている、世話が行き届かない
The children are well cared for―left to take care of themselves.
病人の治療が行き届いている、行き届かない
The sick are carefully treated―not well attended to.
治療が行き届いて病人が全快した
The invalid has recovered owing to careful treatment.
治療が行き届かないために病人が死んだ
The invalid died from want of attention.
看護が行き届いたために病人は早く治った
The invalid recovered quickly owing to careful nursing.
行き届かないところ
one's faults―failings―shortcomings
行き届かないところはご注意を願います
You will remind me of my faults.
まことに行き届かない者です
I am full of shortcomings.
まことに行き届かない者ですがなにぶんよろしくお願い申します
I wish to place under your care this raw and inexperienced youth.

The speaker broke down.

content:
ゆきなやむ〔行き悩む〕
〈自動〉To stand still; to come to a standstill; to come to a dead-lock; to be at a dead set; to break down; to hang fire; to stick

content.content: 弁士が行き悩んだ
The speaker broke down.
資金欠乏のため工事が行き悩んでいる
Owing to lack of funds, the works stand still―The works are at a standstill―the works have come to a standstill.
談判が行き悩んでいる
The negotiations are at a standstill―at a dead set―at a dead-lock.
賛成者が無いので計画が行き悩んだ

そこまではどうかこうか説明が付いたがそこで行き悩んでしまった
I somehow explained as far as that, and there stuck.

content:

to go snow-viewing

content:

content.content: 雪模様あり

content:
ゆきわたる〔行き渡る〕
〈自他動〉To pervade (all); to permeate (all); to extend over or through (all); to spread over (all); to go round

content.content: この思想が社会の全階級に行き渡っている
The idea pervades―permeates―all classes of society.
損害は武蔵一円に行き渡っている
The damage extends over the whole of Musashi.
彼の研究は専門のすべての部分に行き渡っている
His inquiry extends through every portion of his profession.
この風説は都鄙全部に行き渡っている
The rumour has spread all over town and country.
ご馳走は皆に行き渡るだけ有るか
Is there enough good cheer to go round?

content:
ゆく〔行く〕
〈自動〉
1. To go; to be there; to visit (a place)

content.content: 君行くか
Are you going?―Will you go?―Shall you be there?
明日行く
I am going tomorrow―I shall be there tomorrow.
歩いて行くか
Are you going on foot?
馬で行く
I am going on horseback.
歩いて行こう
Let us go on foot!―walk it!
車で行こう
Let us go by rickshaw!―take a rickshaw!
電車で行こう
Let us go by car!―take a car!
汽車で行くか船で行くか
Are you going by rail or by steamer?
陸路行くか海路行くか
Are you going by land or by water?
馬車で公園へ行った
I went in a carriage to the Park―I drove to the park.
馬で王子へ行った
I went on horseback to Oji―I rode to Oji.
町へ行くのか
Are you going to town?―(米国では)―going down town?
田舎へ行く
I am going into the country―(米国では)―going up country.
用が有って町へ行く
I am going to town on business―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Business takes me to town.
用が有って田舎の方へ行く
I am going into the country on business―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Business calls me into the country.
彼は若い時欧米へ行った
He went to Europe and America―visited Europe and America―in his youth.
彼は時々温泉へ行く
He often goes to the hot springs―visits the hot springs.
散歩に行く
to go for a walk
馬乗りに行く
to go for a ride
馬車遊山に行く
to go for a drive
舟漕ぎに行く
to go for a row
猟に行く
to go shooting―go on a shooting expedition
釣りに行く
to go fishing―go on a fishing expedition
舟遊びに行く
to go boating
旅行に行く
to go on a journey
親父は旅行に行って不在です
My father is away on a journey.
航海に行く
to go on a voyage
彼女の夫は航海に行って不在だ
Her husband is away on a voyage.
遠足に行く
to go on an excursion
遠征に行く
to go on an expedition
使いに行く
to go on an errand
病気見舞に行った
I went to inquire after his health―went on a mission of inquiry.
参詣に行く
to go to worship at a shrine―go on a pilgrimage
遊びに行く
(子どもなら)to go out to play―(大人なら)―go on a pleasure-trip―take a holiday―visit the gay quarters
君はどっちの方へ行くか
Which way are you going?
本郷の方へ行く
I am going up Hongo way.
築地の方へはめったに行かない
I seldom go down Tsukiji way.
誰か僕の方へ行く人は無いか
Is any one going my way?
僕は君と同じ方へ行く
I am going your way.
道を行く
to go down a road
君はどの道を行くか
By which way are you going?―Which road will you take?
どの道を行けばよいか
By which way shall I go?―Which road shall I take?
右手の路を行けばよい
Take the one to the right!
真直に行け
Go straight on!―Follow your nose!
どこまで行くのか
How far are you going?
浅草まで行く
I am going as far as Asakusa.
大砲の弾はどれほど行くものか
How far does a cannon-ball go?―What is the range of a shell?
何を着て行こうか
What shall I go in?
着て行く着物が無い
I have nothing to go in.
普段のままで行こう
I will go in my everyday clothes.
僕は行きたい
I wish to go.
行きたいものだ
I should like to go.
行きたかった
I wish I had been there―I should like to have been there.
彼も行きたかったろう
He would have liked to have been there.
さあ行こう
I am ready to go with you.
僕は行く当てが無い
I have nowhere to go―I don't know where to go.
彼は行かない所は無い
He has been everywhere.
彼が行ってから一時間になる
It is an hour since he went―He has been gone an hour.
君に行かれちゃ困る
I don't like to have you go.
急いで行こう
Let us go in haste!―make haste!
ゆるゆる行こう
Let us go at our ease!

content: 2. (=どこへ行っている)to have gone (somewhere)

content.content: 彼は米国へ行っている
He has gone to America―He is in America.
今までどこへ行っておったか
Where have you been all this while?
行ったことがある
I have been in or at a place.
君は米国へ行ったことがあるか
Have you been in America?―Did you ever go to America?
日光へ行ったことがあるか
Have you been at Nikko?―Did you ever go to Nikko?
幾度も行った
I have been there several times.
行って来た
I have been to some place.
(汽車で逢った人に)どこへ行って来たのか
Where have you been?
日光へ行って来ました
I have been to Nikko.
じきに行って来る
I will be there in a trice and be back in a jiffy.
今日中に行って来なけりゃならぬ
I must be there in the course of the day.
先方へ行く
to come
明日君のところへ行くぞ、遊びに行くぞ
I'll come to your house―come to see you―tomorrow.
今行く
I am coming.
今行くから待て
Wait till I come!
僕は後から行く
I will come after you.
きっと行くと言った
I have promised to come without fail.
いっしょに行かないか
Won't you come with me?

content:
6. 
〈以下特例〉

content.content: あっちへ行け
Begone about your business!―Get along with you!―Take yourself away!―Make yourself scarce!―Go away!
馬車で停車場へ行った
I drove to the station.
馬で向島まで行った
I rode as far as Mukojima.
君は何等で行くか
What class are you travelling?
二等で行く
I am travelling second class.
泳いで行けないか
Can't you swim it?

よその家へ行ったら言語挙動に気を付けろ

Were you successful in the examination?
そううまくはいかん

そうはいかん
That can't be done―That is impossible.
そうはいくまいよ

いつもそうばかりはいかん
That is not always possible.

思ったほどにいかない

僕の英語はなかなか完全とはいかない

待つわけにはいきません
I can not wait―It is impossible for me to wait.
捗{はか}がいく
to make good progress
仕事は捗がいきますか
How are you getting along with your work?
もうこうなったらやけくそだ行くところまで行く
Now I am desperate. I will go any length.
人間もそこまで行ってはおしまいだ
A man who has gone so far is past all hope.
節倹もそこまで行ってはおしまいだ

1. (=譲り渡す)→『

content.content: ゆずりわたす〔譲り渡す〕

婦人に席を譲れ

遺言で譲る

I still hold my ground―keep my ground.
人に道をゆずる
to make way for one
この本を一部譲ってくれんか
Can you spare me a copy of this book?

content: 2. (=譲歩する)to concede (a point); to make a concession; to yield (a step); to strain, stretch (a point); to defer, bow (to one's opinion); to give way (to one's superiors); to give up (to one's brothers); to give in (to a stronger man)

content.content: 僕の方でも多少は譲る
I shall make some concessions on my part.
しかしその点だけは譲れぬ
But I can not concede that point.
互いに固く取って少しも譲らぬ
They stand firm in their opinions and make no concessions.
君の意見に譲っておこう
I will defer to your opinion―bow to your opinion.
長者に譲れ
Give way to your betters!
彼は兄弟が無いから譲るということを知らない
He has no brothers to give up to.
君のような強情な人には譲らざるを得ぬ
I can not but give in to a man of your obstinacy.
一歩を譲る
to yield a step―concede a point―strain a point―stretch a point―yield the point
しかたがないから一歩を譲って君の意見に賛成しよう
I shall strain a point and endorse your views.
仮にこの一歩を譲るとしたら僕はどうなるか
Suppose I yield the point, then where do I come in?
僕は一歩も譲らぬ
I will not yield an inch.
二人は互いに一歩も譲らぬ
They will not yield an inch to each other.
先方では要求を一歩も譲らぬ
The other party will not bate a jot of his demands.

content: 3. (=売る)to sell

content.content: 安く譲ろう
I will sell it you cheap.
店の株を譲る
to sell the goodwill of a firm
あの医者は仲間に株を譲った
He has disposed of his practice to a brother physician.

content: 4. (=劣る、負ける)to yield (to one); to be inferior (to the other); to be second (to none); to be behind (one); to be below (one)

content.content: 彼は学問では兄に数歩譲っている
He is much inferior to his brother―far below his brother―far behind his brother―in scholarship.
その点は誰にも譲らぬ
I yield to none in that point.
熱心では誰にも譲らぬ
I am behind no one―second to none―in zeal.
専門に忠実な点においては誰にも譲らぬつもりだ
I hope I am behind no one―second to none―in my fidelity to my profession.
日本は何国に対しても海陸共に一歩も譲らぬ
Japan can hold her own against any power on land or sea.

content: 5. (=延ばす、残しおく)to defer, postpone (a matter to some future occasion); to leave, reserve (a matter for some future occasion)

content.content: この問題は後に譲ろう

委細は後便に譲る
I will reserve the particulars for my next―give full particulars in my next.
この話は他日に譲ろう

このことは次回に譲ろう

content:

The potatoes are well done.

content:
ゆだん〔油断〕
〈名〉
1. Unguardedness; heedlessness; want of caution; lack of vigilance; inattention; security:(=する) to be unguarded; to be off one's guard; to be incautious; to revel in security; to relax one's attention; to take one's eyes off; to be caught napping:(他動詞構文に用いれば)to take no heed of (dangers); to be heed less of (dangers)

content.content: 油断したのが悪かった
I was unguarded―off my guard―revelling in security.
彼は決して油断をせぬ
He is never off his guard―ever on his guard.
ロシア人は旅順を金城鉄壁と恃んで油断しておった
The Russians looked upon Port Arthur as impregnable, and were revelling in fancied security.
瞬時も油断はできぬ
You can't take your eyes off―look off―for a moment.
この子はいたずらで油断も隙も有ったものじゃない
The child is so mischievous that you can't take your eyes off him for a moment.
相手の油断した隙を狙え
Watch for a moment when your man is off his guard!―Take your man off his guard!
手習いは坂に車を押す如く油断をすると後へ戻るぞ
He who learns to write pushes a cart up a slope. Let him relax his efforts ever so little, and down he goes backward.
油断大敵
“Security is a great enemy.”
油断に乗ずる
to take one off one's guard―take one unawares―catch one napping
彼は油断に乗ぜられたのだ、油断をして不意を打たれた
He was taken off his guard―taken unawares―caught napping.
油断をして不意を打たるるな
Don't suffer yourself to be taken off your guard!―Don't let them catch you napping!
油断させる
to throw one off one's guard
あれは我々に油断をさせる手段だ
That is a ruse to throw us off one guard.
油断するな、ご油断召さるな
Beware!―Be on your guard!―Look sharp about you!―You must have all your eyes about you―You must have all your wits about you.
油断すると負けるぞ
Look sharp about you, or you will get beaten.
あの人達と取引をする時は油断するな
You must have all your wits about you in dealing with those men.
あの人には油断するな
Beware of that man!―Guard against that man!―Take heed of that man!
あれは悪い人間だから油断するな
You must beware of that man―guard against that man―take heed of that man―(他動詞構文にすれば)―I must warn you against that man―caution you against that man―put you on your guard against that man.
賞める人には油断をするな
Beware of the man who praises you!
十七娘に油断するな
Take heed of a young wench!
美しい女房持ったら油断するな
Look sharp after a pretty wife!
油断がならぬ
I must be on my guard.
相手が相手だから油断がならぬ
I must be on my guard, for I have no common enemy to deal with.
君は目が早いから油断がならぬ
I must be on my guard against you, for you have such a quick eye.
実に油断のならぬ世の中だ
This is a world where one must have all one's wits about one.
今時の姐さん油断がならぬ
Take heed of a modern fair one!
十六娘は油断がならぬ
There is no trusting a girl of fifteen―Fifteen is a dangerous age for maidens.
あれは油断のならぬ奴だ
He is a sly fox.
お爺さんなかなか油断がならんぞ
The sly old dog!
あれは女にかけては油断のならぬ男だ
He has a bit of the devil in him.
油断無き
vigilant―watchful―alert―heedful―cautious―wary
あの男は挙動があやしいから油断無く注目せよ
His movements are suspicious, Keep a vigilant eye on him!―Keep a watchful eye on him!―Keep an eye on him!―Have an eye on him!
油断無く敵を警戒せよ
Be on the alert for the enemy!
道中ご油断無く
I wish you a safe journey.

content:

〈名〉A hot-water bottle; a foot-warmer

content.content: 湯たんぽを入れて寝る
to get into bed with a hot-water bottle
子どもを湯たんぽを入れて寝かす
to put a child to bed with a hot-water bottle

content:
ゆちゃく〔癒着〕
〈名〉Adhesion; agglutination; conglutination:(=する) to adhere; to heal

content.content: 肺が肋膜に癒着する
The lungs adhere to the pleura.
傷口が癒着する
A wound heals.

content:
ゆづえ〔弓杖〕

content.content: 弓杖を突く
to lean on a bow

content:
ゆっくり
〈副〉Leisurely; at one's leisure; in a leisurely manner; at one's ease; with ease; slowly; deliberately; long:(=する) to be long; to stay long; to take one's own time

content.content: ゆっくり相談しよう
Let us talk the matter over at our leisure!
ゆっくり考えて返事をするがよい
You may think the matter over at your leisure before giving your answer.
ゆっくり行こう
Let us go at our ease!
日光見物は一日でゆっくりできる
You can do the sights of Nikko at your ease in a day.
試験中はゆっくり眠ることもできなかった
I could not sleep at my ease during the examination.
仕事は今日中にゆっくりできます
The work can be finished with ease in the course of the day.
君達のわかるようにゆっくり話そう
I will speak slowly, so that you may understand.
今日はゆっくり遊んで行き給え
Please make a long stay today!
そうゆっくりしてはいられん
I can't stay so long.
君とゆっくり話したいことがある
I wish to have a long talk with you.
またそのうちにゆっくり話しに来給え
Please look me up for a long talk some other time!
この忙しいのにそうゆっくりしていては困る
You must not be so long when we are so busy.
急ぐには及ばない、ゆっくりでよろしい
There is no occasion for haste. There is plenty of time.
ゆっくりやり給え
You may take your own time for doing it.
ごゆっくり召上がれ
I will leave you to your dinner.
どうぞごゆっくり
Excuse me!―You will excuse me for leaving you.
試験が済んで気がゆっくりする
Now that the examination is over, I feel much relieved.

content:

content.content: 彼はゆったりしている
He has an easy manner―a deliberate manner.
いくら忙しくともゆったりかまえている
He is calm and composed in a whirl of business.
ゆったりと坐しておった
He sat in easy state.

content:

content.content: 兄は来春上京すると言って寄越しました
My brother writes to say that he is coming to town in spring next.

content.content: ゆでダコのよう

content.content: ゆで卵を食うと秘結する

Foreign trade shows an unfavourable balance of 10,000,000 yen.
輸入免状
an import permit―an importation permit
輸入申告書
a declaration for importation
輸入願書
an entry for import―an entry inwards
外資輸入

泰西文物の輸入
introduction of things Western

content:
ゆび〔指〕
〈名〉
1. (手の指)a finger:(足の指)a toe

content.content: 五本の指
five fingers
親指
the big finger―the thumb―(足のは)―the big toe
人指し指
the forefinger―the index
中指
the middle finger
薬指
the third finger―the ring-finger
小指
the little finger
指の先
a finger-tip
指の節
the finger-joints―the knuckles
指の跡
a finger-mark―a finger-print
指の跡が付く、指の跡を付ける
to leave finger-marks
本に指の跡が付いている
The book is well thumbed.
指の跡の付いた本
a well-thumbed volume
指を鳴らす
to crack a finger―crack one's fingers
ボタンなどを指でいじる
to finger a button
指を入れる
to insert a finger―introduce a finger
戸に指をはさんだ
I got a finger caught in the door.
この娘には指一本付けても承知せぬぞ
You shall not lay a finger on this girl―You shall not touch this girl.
指を指す
to point one's finger at―point at―point to―anything
人に指を指す
to point one's finger at a man
世人はあの人を指に指す(指を指して笑う)
People―point at him.
人に指を指されぬようにせよ
See that people do not point at you.
入口の方へ指を指した(出て行けの意味)
I pointed to the door.
人の妻たる者は人に指一本指されてもならぬ
A wife should be above suspicion.
人の女房には指でも指すな
You should not look at a man's wife.
人から指一本指されぬように努めます
I will not give my enemies a handle for censure or ridicule.
指をくわえる
to take a finger in one's mouth―put a finger in one's mouth
子どもが指をくわえている
The child has a finger in his mouth.
指をくわえて眺めている
He is looking on with a finger in his mouth.
人が金を儲けるのを指をくわえて眺めているのは辛い
It is hard to look with envious eyes on people making their fortunes.
指をくわえて眺めている僕じゃない
I will not be an idle spectator.
そんなに虐待されて指をくわえている僕じゃない
I will not tamely submit to such treatment.
指を屈する、指折り数える
(日本では)to bend one's fingers―(西洋では)―count anything on one's fingers
そんな人は指を屈するだけしか無い
Such men may be counted on your fingers.
彼は五本の指に数えられるようになった
He is now counted on the fingers.
日本第一の英学者として何人も彼に指を屈する
He is universally acknowledged as the greatest English scholar in Japan―It is acknowledged on all hands that he is the greatest English scholar in Japan.
指を屈するにいとまあらず
They are too numerous to be counted―They are innumerable.
指折り数えて待つ
to look forward to anything
子どもらは指折り数えてお祭りを待っている
The children look forward to the festival.
指を染める
to try―make a trial―make an attempt
皆失敗を恐れて指を染める者が無い
Apprehensive of failure, no one will make the attempt.

子どもらは指折り数えてお祭りを待っている

指折り数えれば早や十年の昔だ
It was ten years ago.
